Jayanti, aged 39, is the leader of a group that hails from Bhawanipatna Town of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband, having one son and two daughters. The member standing second from right with raised hand is Jayanti. 

Jayanti is running a grocery shop with the support of her husband in her locality. Jayanti, along with four other members of her village, formed a group and want to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses for the first time.  

Before accessing the loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her family's daily requirements. She was earning Rs.7,500 per month from her business which is not sufficient to maintain her family. Now she is very much confident in running her business.She has a desire to purchase a refrigerator to keep cold drinks and chocolates to increase her sales.

 Of the other three members of the group, Lochani and Sukanti are doing tailoring and Laxmi is doing vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleada doméstica en diferentes casas de la ciudad pero, desde hace 11 meses decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, fruto de unos ahorros que tenía en compañía con su esposo, abrió una tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en un espacio de la casa donde reside, allí trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm y ofrece diversos productos de la canasta familiar. La cliente es una mujer humilde, sencilla y luchadora, se esmera por sacar adelante su familia, quienes son su principal motor para levantarse día a día. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, productos de aseo, mecato, dulces, gaseosas), de esta manera podrá ampliar su portafolio de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar las ventas y por ende, los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Es así como Luz desea seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y, poco a poco hacerlo crecer e ir progresando en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, además podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz has been working as a domestic employee in different homes all her working life, but she decided to go out on her own and start her own business 11 months ago.  She used her and her husband’s savings to open a grocery store in her home and works there daily from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm, where she offers different family food products.  She is a simple, humble, and hardworking woman who strives to get the family ahead.  They are her main motivation.  She is asking for a loan to buy inventory in quantity (dairy, meats, toiletries, pastries, sweets, soft drinks).  This way she can expand her inventory of products and satisfy her family needs.  This will allow her to increase her sales and income.  This is how Luz wants to continue strengthening her business, growing it little by little, and get ahead with her husband and two children.  She will also be able to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen would like to take a further loan to buy more silk thread to produce a larger quantity of fabric. Duyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business further so she can attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy silk thread for producing fabric

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang, 25, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns an income from running a general store in front of his house. 

He started this business two years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock his store.

loans.name: Lizette Eliana

texts.es: Lizette es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, casada y madre de una hija recién nacida. Hace aproximadamente trabaja con su esposo en una pequeña microempresa de confección que iniciaron en la casa donde viven, allí prestan el servicio de confección a familiares y vecinos del sector, elaborando todo tipo de prendas según los requerimientos de sus clientes, de esta manera han logrado generar los recursos suficientes para salir de la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaron al estar desempleados. Su espíritu de superación, su energía y empuje le han permitido salir adelante y actualmente solicita el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos y materiales al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones), necesarios para elaborar las prendas que les solicitan, así podrán ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues tendrán la facilidad de tener a mano lo necesario. Lizette desea seguir trabajando con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación, motivada por su pequeña hija, además desea cumplir el sueño de fortalecer su negocio, conseguir más clientela y darse a conocer aún más en el sector, para mejorar así la economía del hogar y poder dar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lizette is a young entrepreneur aged 20, who is married and has a newborn daughter. She works with her husband in a small clothes-making business which they set up in their home, where they offer clothes-making services to families and neighbors in the area. They make all kinds of clothing, according to the needs of their customers. In this way, they have managed to make enough money to get out of the difficult financial situation in which they found themselves due to being unemployed. 

Their spirit of improvement, energy and drive have enabled them to move forwards. Lizette is now requesting support in the form of her first loan, with the aim of investing it in buying wholesale inputs and materials (fabric, threads, elastics, and buttons), which she needs to make the clothing ordered by customers.  This will allow them to offer their customers a better service, as they will have everything they need to hand.

Lizette wants to keep working hard, with a great deal of dedication, motivated by her young daughter. She also wants to achieve her dreams of strengthening their business, attracting more customers and becoming better known in the industry, in order to improve the family income and offer her family wellbeing and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale inputs and materials (fabric, threads, elastics, and buttons)

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz, a sus 47 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Durante 15 años se ha dedicado a vender mercancía y hace algún tiempo, logró adquirir una pequeña vitrina donde ofrece los productos en la acera de la casa donde vive, de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a su hijo y al mismo tiempo, estar pendiente de las labores en su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante, amable y carismática, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por esta razón se motiva a solicitar su primer crédito, que invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (sandalias, accesorios para el cabello, aretes, pulseras, anillos, entre otros), así aumentará la variedad en su inventario para satisfacer la demanda  que crece en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos para continuar solventando las necesidades de su hogar, además, Luz desea avanzar para cumplir el sueño de montar un almacén grande y bien surtido, que sea reconocido en el sector y le brinde la posibilidad de mejorar el bienestar y las condiciones de vida para ofrecerle a su hijo, quien es su principal motivación.
texts.en:
Luz is 47 years old.  She has one child and is the head of her household since separating from her husband. Over the past 15 years she has sold merchandise, and some time ago she was able to acquire a small showcase to display her products on the sidewalk in front of her home. In this way she has been able to generate the financial resources to raise her son and still keep up with her household chores. 

She is known as a strong, kind, and charismatic person who always looks for new ways to get ahead, and it is for this reason that she is applying for her first loan.  She will use it to buy wholesale merchandise (sandals, hair accessories, earrings, bracelets, rings, etc.) and thereby increase the variety of her inventory to meet the increasing demand during the coming holiday season.  This will allow her to generate more income and continue to pay her household bills.  Additionally, Luz hopes to fulfill her dream of opening a large, well-stocked shop, known in her area. This will allow her to provide her son with better living conditions and an improved sense of well-being.  He is her main motivation.

loans.use: to buy  merchandise at wholesale (sandals, hair accessories, earrings, bracelets, rings, etc.)

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es: Fabiola, a sus 56 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y cabeza de hogar, vive en un pueblo del oriente antioqueño donde tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de ropa de segunda mano, artículos que compra a diferentes iglesias de la ciudad y que son producto de las donaciones que las personas llevan, estas prendas son enviadas  para su  comercialización a bajos precios. Como toda mujer antioqueña, se caracteriza por ser bastante religiosa y creyente, por esta razón decide aportar a la iglesia parte del dinero que recauda con la venta de la mercancía y lo demás lo utiliza para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Su carisma, empeño y amor por la comunidad, le han permitido ser reconocida en el sector por su bonita labor, esto la motiva para solicitar el primer ciclo de crédito que invertirá en realizar unas adecuaciones del local, comprar una estantería para almacenamiento y además para comprar mercancía (ropa de segunda), de esta manera podrá continuar con su labor y generará mejores ingresos personales. Fabiola sueña con fortalecer su negocio, atraer más clientes y fidelizarlos, así podrá tener una estabilidad económica favorable y mejorará las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: At 56-years-old, Fabiola is a mother of 2 children and the head of her household, living in a village in eastern Antioquia where she has a small shop selling secondhand clothing. She purchases these articles at different churches in the city. These garments are the product of donations that people bring and they are sent to the market at low prices. Like a typical woman from Antioquia, she is characterized by being a religious believer. For this reason, she has decided to bring some of the money she collects from the sale of goods back to the church and the rest is used to cover the costs of her household. Her charisma, commitment, and love of the community have allowed her to be recognized in her market for her beautiful work. This motivates her to apply for her first loan to invest in making some modifications to her store, buying a shelf for storage, and also to purchase goods (used clothing) to be able to continue her work and generate better personal income. Fabiola dreams to strengthen her business, attract more customers and retain them, and have good economic stability and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to make modifications to her store, buy a shelf for storage, and also buy merchandise (used clothes)

loans.name: Marta Aliria

texts.es: Marta es una mujer casada de 61 años de edad, 15 de ellos dedicados a la administración de un inquilinato, donde ofrece el servicio de alquiler de habitaciones por días o por meses, según la necesidad del huésped. La edificación no es propia, ella se encarga de administrar el edificio, los enseres y muebles y además se encarga de la cobranza del arriendo, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, sólo está pendiente de que los clientes no se vayan sin pagar, pues a veces tiene inquilinos muy difíciles. De esta manera, ella genera sus ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para comprar camas, colchones, armarios, cobijas, sábanas, entre otros, con el fin de amoblar bien las habitaciones y prestar un buen servicio a sus clientes y de cierta manera aportarles para mejorar la calidad de vida, lo que afectará de manera positiva los ingresos que recibe, pues tendrá inquilinos más conformes y no será tan difícil la labor de cobranza. Marta solo desea seguir trabajando arduamente y generar una buena imagen en el negocio para los futuros inquilinos, lo que le garantizará a ella obtener buenos ingresos para disfrutar con su esposo una vejez tranquila y con buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Marta is a married woman of 61 years. She has dedicated 15 of those years to the administration of a tenement house which offers the service of rented rooms for days or months as required by the guest. The building is not her own. She is responsible for managing the building, furniture, and appliances and is also responsible for the collection of rent. She does not have a set work schedule but she is always alert so that clients do not leave without paying because sometimes they have very difficult guests. Through this job she generates income to contribute to the economy of her home. She is currently seeking a loan to buy beds, mattresses, wardrobe, blankets, sheets, etc. in order to furnish the rooms and provide good service to her customers. It will provide her a way to improve her quality of life and positively affect the income she receives through more satisfied tenants that are less difficult to collect from. Marta only wants to continue to work hard and build a good image of the business to prospective tenants which will guarantee good income for her and her husband to enjoy a peaceful old age and good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beds, mattresses, wardrobes, blankets, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad, ha trabajado en el arte de estampación de camisetas y con el dinero que ganaba fue ahorrando para luego independizarse. Hace algún tiempo logró su objetivo y con los ahorros que tenía compró algunas máquinas de confección,  con lo que pudo montar su propio taller, donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros. Cuenta con el apoyo de varias empleadas directas que normalmente se encargan de coser las prendas, mientras él se dedica a transportar los lotes de producción para hacer o las prendas ya terminadas, pero cuando se incrementa la producción, él también se dedica a confeccionar. Su empuje, entusiasmo y proyección lo han llevado a lograr objetivos que a su edad, la mayoría aún ni se imaginan. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos necesarios al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, elásticos), de esta manera tendrá el capital de trabajo suficiente para poder cumplir a tiempo con la entrega de las producciones, así podrá aumentar los contratos, lo que se traduce en mejores ingresos. Alexis desea seguir trabajando con empeño y dedicación para hacer de su negocio una microempresa exitosa, rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y, en un futuro desea adquirir más máquinas y ofrecer más oportunidades de empleo, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia y la de las demás personas que influyen en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
Alexis is 23 years old and is a young entrepreneur. He has made a living by printing t-shirts and, with the money that he earned, continued to save so that he could become independent. Some time ago, he achieved his goal and purchased some sewing machines with his savings. He started a workshop where he offers his sewing services as a third party. 

He has many employees who normally sew the garments while he transports the unfinished or complete batches but, when production increases, he also sews.

His drive, enthusiasm, and impact have allowed him to achieve goals that many people his age can't even imagine.

He requests the loan so that he can invest it in the purchase of necessary supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic). This way, he will have enough working capital to be able to complete his productions on time, increase his contracts, and earn more money.

Alexis wants to continue working with determination and dedication to make his small business successful, profitable, and long-lasting. In the future, he would like to acquire more machines and offer more jobs, improving his the quality of life of his family and of the other people who inspire him in this difficult work.

loans.use: to buy necessary supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic)

loans.name: Nyadzuwa

texts.en:
Nyadzuwa is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has been preparing chapatti (flat bread), selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Nyadzuwa dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking  oil

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to create a new business of making meals for selling. She intends to take a loan to buy rice, ingredients, and raw food to make better meals to sell to her customers in her community. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, and to offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase rice, ingredients, and raw food

loans.name: Ankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  six  membres du groupe  ANKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  AWA  à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de perles.
Elle compte investir tout son prêt dans les perles qu’elle transforme en colliers et les revend en à la maison et au grand marché à une place fixe à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the ANKADI group are married women, aged 40 on average, and with six children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou, one of the most populous quarters of Sikasso, in the third largest administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, in order to satisfy their customers' needs. Mme Awa - on the far right - sells beads for a living. She aims to use her loan to buy beads from which she will make necklaces, and sell them in people's homes and in the large central market. She sells to a primarily female customer base, and takes cash sales. 
She aims to drive average monthly profits of 40,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay her loan and its interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: to purchase beads

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 58, is married and has five children; four sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband is retired. 

Hien has been running a general store in front of her door for 17 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and generate income to raise her children. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Oscar Darío

texts.es: Oscar es un campesino que se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, aprendió de sus padres, quienes se han dedicado durante toda la vida a trabajar como jornaleros, cosechando diversidad de alimentos, según la temporada del año. Actualmente posee algunos cultivos y requiere cuidarlos y preparar la tierra para la temporada de cosecha que se aproxima, esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas), con los que podrá continuar su labor y sacar una cosecha más productiva para comercializarla más fácilmente en el mercado del pueblo donde reside. De esta manera, Oscar desea seguir progresando, generar mejores ingresos que le den la oportunidad de disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Oscar is a farmer who has made a living in agriculture from a young age. He learned this from his parents, who spent their whole lives working as laborers, harvesting a range of crops depending on the time of year. At the moment, he has various crops and needs to tend them and prepare the ground for the harvest season, which is getting closer.

This is his motivation for requesting the loan, which will be invested in buying wholesale agricultural inputs (compost, pesticides, and fungicides). With these, he will be able to keep working and achieve a higher crop yield, which he can then sell more easily in the market of the town in which he lives. In this way, Oscar wants to keep progressing, and boost his earnings, which allow him to enjoy economic stability so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural inputs (compost, pesticides, and fungicides).

loans.name: Asikia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe ASIKIA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Bintou fait le commerce de pagnes dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tien deuxième  position de la  droite vers la gauche.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 7 pièces de pagnes wax paniers qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché de Sanoubougou 1. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the ASIKIA group are married women, aged 34 on average, and with 4 children each. They primarily live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou - one of Sikasso's most populous quarters, in the third largest administrative region of Mali. 
They are on their seventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of satisfying their customers' demands. Mme Bintou sells colourful pagnes cloths for a living. She is the second on the right in the photograph. She aims to use her loan in order to buy 7 pieces of wax cloth which she will sell at retail at people's homes and in the Sanoubougou 1 market. She aims to generate an average monthly profit over 32500 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay her loan and interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colourful cloths)

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband earns money through a business of weaving. For ten years, she has made and sold Christmas trees to support her family.

Trang would like a loan to purchase better quality materials to make more beautiful Christmas trees. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers, and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make and sell Christmas trees.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a single 40-year-old woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a food stall to sell noodles with beef and crabs for seven years. 

She intends to use her loan to buy better quality ingredients and food to make better dishes to sell.

She hope her business runs smoothly, and will help her to improve her living conditions and save money for her needs.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and food.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 55 years old and married with three children; a son and two daughters. Her husband is a driver for hire. Tam started a grocery store 38 years ago. She sells potatoes, bitter melons, garlic, tomatoes, chilies, onions, and cabbages.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of vegetables to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 24 years old and married with a daughter. Hung lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh city. His wife earns income through running a laundry business. Hung runs a food stall to earn a living. 

He started his business two years ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying a variety of different foods to sell to his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and  helps him improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different foods to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se han esforzado al máximo para poder salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener y no tener que pasar por necesidades.
Una persona digna de destacar es Reina, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella siempre motiva a sus compañeras a seguir creciendo y luchando por lo que quieren. Ella trabaja en su librería,  y tiene todo tipo de productos, su meta es poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros, cuadernos, lápices y demás, que le ayudara a surtir su local y seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this committee carry out a variety of activities.  Each one of them has striven to the maximum to be able to get ahead and to give their families what they were unable to have themselves so that they don't have to suffer any wants.

One of them worthy of note is Reina who is the group president.  She always encourages her fellow members to continue growing and striving for what they want.  She works in her bookstore and has all types of products.  Her goal is to be able to continue to grow and to improve her family’s life.  

She requests this loan to buy books, notebooks, pencils and others to help stock her store and continue to give her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a 22 year old single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, flour etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are small scale buyers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, rice flour and other items. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice flour and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old. She is married and has been in the business of foodstuffs for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man; he has three children, with ages ranging from 6 to 12. He describes himself to be courageous. 

Joseph operates a retail shop where he sells bread, sweets, flour, paper, soap, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap, and other items. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet demands of his clients. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy a stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap, and other items

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

David operates a farm where he grows carrots and potatoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a highly populated area with big land for farming.  His primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during the rain season transportation is a problem. 

David will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will give his family the best. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Aminata.  She is married, and she has two children, ages 15 & 10 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sales assistant.  

In 2002, Aminata established her business selling bags, synthetic hair, cosmetics, wedding dresses, etc.  She began her business because there was no one to pay for her to continue her.education. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 . Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more bags, synthetic hair, etc., for resale. 

In the future, Aminata plans to get a sophisticated saloon for men and woman and generate more income to live a better life. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags, cosmetics, synthetic hair, etc., for resale

loans.name: Gnemogognouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe GNEMOGOGNOUMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Fama  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Korotoumou fait le commerce  des fruits et légumes et des tubercules dans ce groupe de femmes de la GNEMOGOGNOUMA elle se tien assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des bananes, papayes qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the GNEMOGOGNOUMA group are married women who are aged 40 on average, and have 5 children each. They mostly live in monogamous families in Fama, one of the most populous quarters of Sikasso, in the third largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their tenth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, in order to satisfy their customers' demand. 
Mme Korotoumou is a group member, and sells fruit, vegetables and bulbs for a living. She is sitting down in the front row of the photograph. She aims to use her loan to buy bananas and papayas, which she will sell at retail to families, and to a customer base mainly made up of women. She mainly takes cash sales. 
She aims to drive average monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, and the rest  of which will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Doi

texts.en:
Doi, 44, is married and has a child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a shop to sell softdrinks in front of their house for ten years. Doi is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different kinds of softdrinks to better satisfy her customers.

Doi hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 59, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. She earns an income by running a general store in front of her house. 

Hong started this business thirty years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

Hong hopes her business run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 47 years old and is married. His wife sells sweetened porridge. He supports his family by both making and recycling garments, which he has done for 10 years. He started this activity to cover his expenses and raise his three children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying sewing machines so that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business.  He hopes that through this loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest into his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien is 47 years old and is married. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a salesman. 

Chien has run a general store at her house for 10 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.  

Chien hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

Phuong hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen would like to take another loan to buy sewing machines to sell from her stall.  Quyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy sewing machines to sell

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is 50 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a salesman. 

Tuyen has been running a business selling scrap fabric for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tuyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying higher quantities of fabrics to increase her sales. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: buy scrap fabrics to sell

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu would like to take another loan to buy new furniture, plates, spoons and chopticks for her food stall. Nu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy furniture and supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh would like to take another loan to purchase pork, bread and an electrical rice cooker. Trinh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy pork, bread and a rice cooker

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is requesting a new loan to buy to purchase fish sauce and soybean sauce to stock her general store. 

This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase her sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish sauce and soybean sauce to stock her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as coke, sugar, and seasoning powder to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, will increase sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase coke, sugar, and seasoning powder.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan, which she will use to buy new plates, spoons, beef and noodles. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income, to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and further increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new plates, spoons, beef, and noodles

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son would like to take a further loan to buy pork, bread, and other foods to sell from her stall. Son's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income, to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pork, bread, and other food for selling at her stall

loans.name: Idier

texts.es: Idier es un hombre trabajador y activo, con ganas de superarse y salir adelante en compañía de su esposa. Actualmente desea iniciar un negocio propio, con el fin de complementar los ingresos familiares, ya que el salario que gana algunas veces no le alcanza para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar y en el actualmente su esposa se encuentra desempleada. Quiere comenzar una tienda de abarrotes, en un pequeño espacio que tiene disponible en la casa donde vive, para ello solicita el crédito, pues con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, galletería, enlatados, entre otros), así podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo en el que trabajará de forma alterna a su empleo, ya que sus horarios son divididos y en los momentos de ausencia contará con el apoyo de su esposa, con esta actividad espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y darse a conocer en el sector, para que poco a poco su negocio vaya creciendo y fortaleciendo. Idier desea que este proyecto se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos, para lo que trabajara arduamente y así llegar a cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, en un futuro poder adquirir un local más grande e independiente de su unidad familiar y generar mejores ingresos para dar a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Idier is an active hard worker wanting to excel and get ahead with his wife. Currently, he wants to start a business in order to supplement his family income as the wages he is earning are not enough to meet the basic needs of his home. His wife is currently unemployed. He wants to start a grocery store in a small space he has available in the house where he lives. He's seeking a loan for it because with the money he can buy an assortment of wholesale goods (grains, pasta, biscuits, canned goods, etc.) so that he can launch this new project in which he will work alternately dividing his schedule with his other employment. In times of absence, he will have the support of his wife. He hopes to improve the lives of his family and become known in the field as his business slowly grows and strengthens with this activity. Idier wants this business to become their primary source of income and to work hard so he comes to fulfill the dream of expanding his business. In the future, he would like to acquire a larger premises that is apart from the family home and generate better income to give his wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (grains, pasta, biscuits, canned goods, etc.).

loans.name: Víctor Alfonso

texts.es: Víctor es un campesino de 28 años de edad, dedicado a la agricultura desde que era muy joven, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus familiares. Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca, ñame, arroz y maíz, alimentos que cosecha y comercializa en el mercado de la región, además alterna esta labor prestando el servicio de jornalero, así complementa los ingresos que recibe y con los que aporta a la economía de su hogar. Su empuje, tenacidad y dedicación le han permitido sobrepasar las dificultades que se le presentan, pues se motiva por las ganas que tiene de progresar. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su labor, con el dinero desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, larvicidas, fertilizantes), así podrá preparar el terreno para la temporada de cosecha que se aproxima y así sacar una producción más limpia y con excelente calidad, lo que le facilita la venta en el mercado. Para él, esto significa tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y solventando algunas necesidades de su hogar. Víctor desea seguir luchando para conseguir mejores ingresos y tener la oportunidad de ofrecer a sus padres  mejores condiciones de vida, además quiere hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, para mejorar la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Victor is a 28-year-old farmer, and he has been in the field since he was very young, thanks to the education he received from his family. He currently grows yuca (also known as cassava or manioc), yam, rice, and corn, food crops that he harvests and sells in a regional market. He alternates between farming and working as a day-laborer, complementing his farming income and enabling him to support his household economy. His drive, tenacity, and dedication have enabled him to overcome the difficulties that life has presented him with, and he is constantly driven by the desire to get ahead. 

He is requesting this loan to support him as he continues with his work. With the money, he wishes to buy farming supplies at wholesale, including manure, pesticides, larvicides, and fertilizers.  These will help him prepare the land for the upcoming harvest, get a cleaner, higher-quality crop, and ultimately sell his harvest more easily at market. For him, this means greater income, which he will invest in his business and use to meet some of his household necessities. Victor wants to keep fighting to earn more money and have the opportunity to provide his parents with better living conditions. He also hopes to make his business both profitable and long-lasting so that he can help his entire family.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Rebecca.  She is married, and has one child, age 8. 

In 2009, Rebecca established her used items business. She began her business because of a low salary income. Working seven days a week and 10 hrs a day, she earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le3,000,000.  Rebecca requires a loan to purchase more used items in very large quantity to sell. 

In the future, Rebecca plans to educate her child to university level, and to construct a house. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used household  items to sell.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Bintu is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 11 and 7.  She has two additional dependents, who live with her for schooling in the city.  

In 2009, Bintu established her frozen fish business. She began her business to help her husband in solving some family issues. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city. and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 every month from this business.

Bintu is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase frozen fish to sell. She hopes that this loan will increase her profits. 

In the future, Bintu plans to get one cool room for her to start generating income. She was still unable to get a cool room, but she is still hoping to get one that will help her get more profit. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Мукаддас несколько лет работает в средней школе. Ее муж имеет маленький доход и не в состоянии обеспечить своих 3 детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить сухофрукты. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму    4000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A woman, who is a guardian of her home's hearth and a foundation for her children, has a grand idea to organize a new business. Mukaddas has been working at a school for several years.  Her husband has a small income and cannot provide their three children with all of the necessities.  The children require more comforts year-after-year because they are developing in step with the developing world.  Mukaddas decided to organize a business in buying and selling dried fruit.  She searched for help for a long time and finally learned about the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women.  She participated in this course and got a lot of positives for herself.  She obtained a certificate after completing this course.  Now she is ready to start her business, but does not have money to buy dried fruit.  She will sell it at a local market.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy dried fruit.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to start her own business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es dueña de una despensa, y también de un comedor, se dedica a esto hace más de 7 años. Ella es separada y cuenta que vive con sus hijos, y por medio de su trabajo les ha podido dar todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago, ella quiere seguir trabajando y luchando por un futuro mejor. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y poder tener un mejor local donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la despensa, como ser verduras, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria owns a small grocery store and also a diner. She has run these businesses for more than seven years. She is separated and lives with her children, and this work is how she has been able to provide them with everything they need.

She is a hard working, enterprising person with good repayment discipline. She wants to keep working and fighting for a better future. Her goal is to keep growing and eventually get a better location where she can make her customers more comfortable. 

Maria is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for the grocery stores, such as vegetables, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and more. She is grateful for the assistance that she is receiving as it will help her a lot.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Viila Yvate Group

texts.es:
Villa Yvate se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé, con 17 integrantes, todas ellas mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras. Una de ellas es Nilsa, quien además de ser miembro del grupo, es la presidenta.
Ella ayuda a sus compañeras a trabajar y fomenta el trabajo en equipo. Es una persona muy trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Sueña con poder seguir con sus ventas y el día de mañana poder tener una mayor clientela que le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos y le permita seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en lencería para la venta, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando. También agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Villa Yvate” was formed in the city of Caacupé with 17 members.  All are hardworking, driven women.  One of them is Nilsa who besides being a member of the group is also its president.

She helps her fellow members and encourages teamwork.  She’s a very hardworking woman who with much effort and sacrifice is getting ahead.  She dreams with being able to continue in sales so that in future she can have a larger clientele that will help her increase her income and allow her to continue helping her family.

She requests this loan to buy lingerie to sell and continue working.  She is also thankful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cuatro integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero deben seguir luchando.
Virgilia se dedica a la venta de comestibles, y cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que sus comestibles son muy ricos y solicitados, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias a su buen producto y gracias a  que siempre es una persona muy agradable con sus ventas.
La Sra Virgilia solicita de este crédito para la compra de panificados, Conservantes, verduras, carnes y demás  lo que le ayudará a tener mayores ingresos y comestibles. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño” (Divine Child) is in cycle 11 in the women’s committee program.  All of them work and help each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and four of the members are below the poverty line, that is, with very low income; but they must continue striving.

Virgilia works selling food and she relates that she does very well since her dishes are very delicious and quite sought-after.  She’s acquired a very good clientele thanks to her good product and thanks to her always being a very pleasant person while selling.

Virgilia’s asking for this loan to buy baked goods, preservers, vegetables, meat and other things that will help her increase her income and her dishes.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, preservers, vegetables, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Massah.  She is married, and has two children, ages 10 and 3. 

In 2000, Massah established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. 

In the future, Massah plans to construct a bakery as another source of income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ripsime

texts.en:
Ripsime is an agronomist from Norashen village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, her school-age daughter and son (15 and 12 years old), and her parents-in-law. Ripsime's husband works in the private sector. However, he cannot fully meet the family's needs based on his salary alone. To help her husband in earning a living, Hripsime is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and hens, and in cultivation of tomatoes, peppers, peaches, apricots, cherries, plums, strawberries, pomegranate, grapes, apples and pears. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

To sustain the agribusiness and develop it further, Rripsime currently needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase a new piece of land and to buy some forage for the livestock. As this is Ripsime’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the good will and support in helping them sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a new piece of land and to buy some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en: Fortune is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have seven children. She has been selling beers for the past fifteen years. She wants the loan to buy more crates of beers for sale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beers for sale.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak is a farmer from the village Qarakert of Armavir region. He lives with his mother. He works in the private sector, but the salary is so low that he hardly meets the needs of his family. To be able to cover the basic costs, Artak is engaged in breeding pigs, which is a very important source of income for Artak’s family. His mother helps him in everyday activities related to livestock breeding. To sustain his agribusiness Artak currently needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase one pig and some forage for his pigs. The loan will help him to sustain his agribusiness and develop it further. Artak and his mother will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support in helping them collect the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase one pig and some forage for his pigs.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong would like to take a further loan, which she will use to pay school fees for her children and to repair the toilet in her home. Suong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and repair her toillet.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Rugiatu.  She is married, and she has three children, ages 10, 8 and 4 years.

In 2006, Rugiatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in supporting their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours  a day, she earns about SLL 250,000 every month from her business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000.  Rugiatu requires a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to educate her children to the university level and to construct a house.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mafulay

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Mafulay.  She is married and has two children who are 15 & 10 years old. In 2000, Mafulay established her soft drinks and alcohol  business. She began her business because she was not educated. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 410,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in of Le 4,000,000.  Mafulay requires a loan to purchase more drinks, both hard and soft, for resale. In the future, Mafulay plans to build a house for dwelling. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, both hard and soft, for resale.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a salesman.

Trang has been running a general store in front of her house for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying basic goods to stock her store and to pay her children's school fees.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her store and to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker at a construction company.

Trang has been running a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying basic goods to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршеду 39 лет. Он живет в столице Душанбе. У него есть семья дети.  Они являются мотивацией для продвижения вперед. 7 месяцев назад по нужде Хуршед продал свой автомобиль. Сейчас он хочет купить машину и заняться маршрутным такси. Хуршед будет возить пассажиров на своей собственной машине. Он будет работать на одной из линии города. За один проезд с одного клиента Хуршед будет брать 3 сомони ( 0,63$), как и другие водители маршрутного такси. 
   Хуршед рассчитанный человек и в дальнейшем он видит свое будущее светлым. Чтобы его будущее было так, как он представляет, ему нужен автомобиль для предоставления услуги маршрутного такси. Чтобы купить машину ему не хватает 1000$. Он просит данную сумму в кредит. Хуршеду очень нужна машина, чтобы начать зарабатывать. Он надеется на Вашу отзывчивость!
texts.en: Khurshed is 39 years old.  He lives in the capital Dushanbe.  He has a family and children.  They are the motivation for moving forward.  Khurshed had to sell his car 7 months ago.  Now he wants to purchase a car and become involved in a taxi business.  Khurshed will transport passengers in his own car.  He will work on one of the city routes.  Khurshed will charge 3 somoni ($0.63) per passenger, per ride, just like other taxi drivers.  Khurshed is a calculated person and sees a bright future ahead.  He needs a car to provide a taxi service for the future to be as he envisions it.  He is short $1000 from buying a car.  He is requesting this amount as a loan.  Khurshed really needs a car to start earning money.  He hopes for your responsiveness!

loans.use: to buy a car to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Рузибой проживает с женой и двумя сыновьями в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Ему 55 лет. Он предоставляет услуги сантехника, а жена работает в кондитерском цехе. Старшему сыну Рузибоя 24 года и у него собственный бизнес. Младшему сыну 22 года. Он еще студент и учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете в факультете иностранных языков. Рузибой сейчас должен оплатить за учебу сына в университете. У него на руках нет такой большой суммы и поэтому он решил обратиться за кредитом. Он просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. Рузибой как заботливый родитель думает о будущем сына и хочет, чтобы он имел высшее образование. Он считает высшее образование залогом успешной карьеры.
texts.en:
Ruziboy lives with his wife and two sons in the B. Gafurov region, in the city of Khujand. He is 55 years old. He provides a plumbing service and his wife works in a confectionery store. Ruziboy's eldest son is 24 years old and he has his own business. The youngest son is 22 years old. He is still a student and studies at the Khujand State University, in the faculty of foreign languages. 

Ruziboy currently needs to pay for his son's tuition at the university. He does not have such a large sum at hand, and therefore he decided to apply for a loan. He requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar. Ruziboy, as an attentive father, thinks of his son's future. He would like his son to have higher education. He thinks higher education is a guarantee for a successful career.

loans.use: to pay for his son's higher education

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cecilia está casada con Ramón tienen con 2 hijos mayores que ya tienen sus vidas independientes a ella, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo hoy son personas de bien.
Ella tiene una despensa desde el año 2003 bien surtida y muy conocida en le barrio, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Cuenta que monto su despensa con la ayuda de su marido, cuando vieron que se encontraban en un punto estratégico para el negocio. Además de su despensa tienen otros ingresos que son de alquiler de cuartos. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. 
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, arroz, fideo, bebidas y otros, con lo que quiere poder surtir su local y así seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
Cecilia and her husband Ramón have two grown children. The children are independent, and thanks to their parents' hard work, they have grown into fine young people.  Cecilia has run a small, home-based grocery store since 2003. It is well stocked and well known in the neighborhood, and she works there every day starting in the early hours of the morning. She and her husband started the grocery store when they realized that they had a strategic location for the business. Apart from their grocery store, they also earn income by renting rooms.  Cecilia is a hard-working, honest person, well known and well liked by everyone who lives in her neighborhood.

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of flour, rice, noodles, drinks, and more, with which she will stock her store and continue to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
Santa Ines está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comités, donde todas se están esforzando por mejorar. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta d eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero trabajan por seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella está mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas  y con su crédito quiere comprar gran cantidad de  jeans, blusas, y lencerías varias prendas más y con ello abarata los costos para obtener mejor ganancia.  Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben. Que les ayudara a seguir creciendo como personas y emprendedoras.
texts.en:
“Santa Inés” is in cycle #1 in the committee program.  All of them are striving to improve.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and two of them are below the poverty line, that is with very low income but they work to continue growing.

One of the members is Mirta who is in poverty level one on the survey, that is with low income.  By means of her effort and non-stop work and by applying the vital behaviors of successful women, she’s improving her poverty situation but she’s nonetheless aware that the work and effort she’s making must be continuous and permanent.

She sells clothes and will use her loan to buy large amounts of jeans, blouses, lingerie and other articles of clothing.  By doing so, she decreases her costs to earn higher profits.  

They are all grateful for the opportunity they are getting that will help them continue growing as persons and as entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mente Psitiva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mente positiva  está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien en su  encuesta mostró que debe esforzarse un poco más, y ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo esta mejorando su vida. Comenta que se dedica a la costura, y que con ello puede ayudar a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas varias para confección y con ello abarata los costos para obtener mejor ganancia.  Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “Mente Positiva” (Positive Outlook) group is in cycle #2 in the committee program.  All of them committed to work and help each other out in order to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and two out of the 17 women are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Blanca whose survey indicated that she must make a bit more of an effort so that by means of it and her continuous work she will be improving her life.  She comments that she works sewing and is able to help her family this way. 

She’s requesting this loan to buy assorted fabrics for clothes making.  By doing so she decreases her costs and is able to earn higher profits.  She’s grateful for the help she’s getting that will make it possible for her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has two children, aged 15 and 10 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him for schooling.

In 1999, Mohamed established his pharmacy business. He began his business, because his salary was very small, and he was unable to take care of the home. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan, in order to buy more drugs for resale. In the future, Mohamed plans to get a clinic on his own. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Adama.  She is married, and has two children, ages 20 and 15.

In 2000, Adama established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in some family issues. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs  a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le5,000,000 to purchase more cartons of frozen fish to sell.

In the future, Adama plans to educate her children to university level, and to construct a house. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of  frozen fish to sell.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 35, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a cook for a restaurant, and she earns an income running a general store in the front of her house. 

She started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foods and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Mo

texts.en:
Mo, 30, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a laborer. She earns an income running a food stall to sell roast meat and other food for her customers. 

She started this business three years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality ingredients and food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality ingredients and food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 50 years old and is single. She has been running a food stall and general store in front of her door, for eight years. She started this business to cover her expenses. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuong is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by offering more kinds of dishes. For example, she plans to offer beef noodles and crab noodles. She thinks that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To make and sell more kinds of dishes, such as beef noodles and crab noodles.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 49 years old and divorced. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For eight years, Hoa has run a shop to sell household appliances. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of appliances to sell at her shop.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of appliances to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё родилась в 1986 года. Она разведенная и имеет 2 детей. Ее дети еще маленькие. Старшему сыну 7 лет и младшему 3 года. Махлиё развелась с мужем 3 года назад. Она единственная кормилица своих детей, так как ее муж не помогает ей по обеспечению детей. Она упорно работает с раннего утра до позднего вечера для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить своих детей. Она более 8 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Махлиё предоставляет свои услуги в ателье. Она должна купить зимнюю одежду для своих детей, а также ей необходимо запасать продукты питания на зиму. Она не имеет денег и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mahliyo was born in 1986.  She is divorced and has two children.  Her children are still small.  The oldest son is 7 years old and the youngest is 3.  Mahliyo got divorced three years ago.  She is the sole provider for her children because her husband is not helping her with providing for the children.  She works hard from early morning to late evening to earn money and feed her children.  She has been involved in her own business for over 8 years.  She provides seamstress services.  Mahliyo provides her services at an atelier.  She has to purchase winter clothing for her children and also necessary food products for the winter.  She does not have money and this is why is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing and food products for her children

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 36, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a bricklayer. 

Dung started a shop to sell soft drinks and make clothes three years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of sewing materials and soft drinks to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buying a greater variety of sewing materials and soft drinks

loans.name: Oumar

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Oumar.  He is married and has three children, aged 20, 17 and 15 years.

In 2003, Oumar established his pharmacy business. He began his business, because he wanted to help himself and his children's welfare. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Oumar requires a loan, in order to buy more drugs and cosmetics for resale. In the future, Oumar plans to open a bigger pharmacy, and build his own dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Safiatu.  She is married and has three children, aged 22, 13 and 12 years.

In 2003, Safiatu established her business, selling foods and drinks. She began her business, because she wanted to help with her children's education and ensure the smooth running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Safiatu requires a loan, in order to buy items for resale, including bags of rice, cooking oil, and drinks. In the future, Safiatu plans to build more houses and stores, for expansion of her business. She also plans to educate her children, up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, including bags of rice, cooking oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan would like to take a further loan to buy an overlocking machine (a type of sewing machine) and some fabric. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy overlocking machine and some fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en:
Tiresa is a 27-year-old married woman with four children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Tiresa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, bush knives, and a backpack sprayer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits,Tiresa hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, bush knives, and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru:
Музаффару 60 лет. Он из села Кубодиён, женат, имеет детей. Музаффар берет кредит, чтобы начать свой бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Он расчетливый мужчина и во всем у него есть план, в том числе и на будущий бизнес. 
  Музаффар будет покупать маленьких телят на местном рынке. Телят будет держать и кормить в течение 30-35 дней. После продаст их на том же рынке. У Музаффара имеется место для содержания скота и достаточно корма. Только нет достаточного начального капитала, чтобы приобрести трех телят. Музаффар действительно нуждается в данном кредите.
texts.en:
Muzaffar is 60 years old. He is from the village of Qubadiyon. He is married and has children. Muzaffar takes a loan to start his own business of fattening and selling cattle. He is a prudent man and he has a plan for everything, including his future business.

Muzaffar will purchase small calves at the local market. He will keep and feed the calves for a period of 30-35 days. Then he will sell them at the same market.
