Martha  tiene 50 años en la foto la de la blusa ploma y cartera café, casada con dos hijitos,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la su propio domicilio,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como abarrotes, aceite y papa,  la Sra. Martha  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida pero ella les atiende con mucha amabilidad que hace que sus clientes vayan por ella y el buen sazón que le pone a sus comidas, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
The DORCAS Entrepreneurial Bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man. Martha is the president of the bank. She is 50 years old, pictured above in the patterned blouse and the brown purse. She is married with two little children, and she works selling food from her own home. This loan is her first cycle with this institution, and she will use this loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, potatoes, and various foodstuffs. 

Martha faces challenges in her business such as competition, as there are several people who are also dedicated to the sale of food, but Martha serves puts good seasoning in her food and treats her customers very kindly, so they them come to her. She hopes to continue making sales through her business and one day have a restaurant.This will allow her to provide a greater level of comfort for her customers, to grow her business, increase her income, and in the end improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for making their meals.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 57 years old, married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Geraldine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Geraldine has requested a loan of PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Geraldine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Geraldine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Celi

texts.es: Mary es una joven de 21 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 1 año de nacido. Actualmente se dedica a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, con el ánimo de generar los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar las necesidades y gastos familiares. Esta idea surgió de un hermano  que inicialmente le enviaba la mercancía para que ella la vendiera y, poco a poco fue adquiriendo su clientela durante un año que lleva realizando esta actividad. Su espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de superarse y salir adelante la impulsan a buscar opciones que le permitan avanzar. Motivada por su hijo, ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada navideña que ya se aproxima, esto le permitirá generar mejores ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo. Mary desea seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación para llegar a cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, hacer que sea rentable para que le dé la oportunidad de disfrutar con su hijo de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mary is a 21 year old young woman.  She is a single mother, and she has a one year old child.  She currently sells merchandise to family members, friends, and neighbors.  She does this in order to generate enough financial resources to pay for the necessities and the family expenses.  This idea came from a brother who initially sent the merchandise for her to sell.  

Little by little she has been acquiring her clientele during the year that she has been doing this business activity.  Her entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to succeed and get ahead drive her to seek options that will allow her to advance.  

Motivated by her child, she is requesting the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, t-shirts, and underwear).  This way she will be able to stock up in order to satisfy the demand that increases during the Christmas season that is approaching.

This will allow her to generate better income to pay for the household necessities and to watch out for her little child’s well-being.  Mary wishes to continue working with care and dedication in order to fulfill her dream of establishing her own store where she will be able to better tend to her customers.  She dreams of making it more profitable so that she has the chance to enjoy a better quality of life with her child.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, t-shirts, and underwear).

loans.name: Dayha

texts.en:
Dayha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell plastic wares business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like basins, dustpans, laundry baskets, etc., to sell for her business.

Dayha has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from  food vending.

Dayha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like basins, dustpans, laundry baskets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonarda works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Leonarda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional supplies like linens, threads, tailoring material and similar items for her tailoring business.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like linens, threads and tailoring material

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old and married, with six children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, milk, noodles, spices, etc.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 29 years, and she also earns an income from farming rice.

Elsie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, milk, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun, who is 37 years old, is from the village of Baray in the district of Kampong Thom province. She lives with her spouse and children, three of whom are employed at various careers and the other four are still attending school. 

She and her husband help each other work in farming rice. However, their income is low and barely enough to cover their living expenses and provide for their children, so they are also dedicated to their poultry-raising business to supplement their income, primarily raising ducks for meat and eggs. It becomes an important source of income for the family after rice farming.

To be able to meet the growing needs of her family, Soeun now wants to buy more ducks to raise. Due to the lack of capital, she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 through the HKL branch office in the province. 

This loan will be a great help for her to sustain and develop her agribusiness and enhance her living status. 

She is very grateful to all the lenders for their generosity in helping her to get ahead in her current business.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc., for her food business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years.  She also earns income from raising pigs.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Celsa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Celsa has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Celsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lidia Rosa

texts.es: Lidia es una mujer trabajadora de 55 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a vender productos de belleza, artículos que 2 de sus hijas le envían desde la costa atlántica, ya que ellas son distribuidoras, Lidia les paga al costo y las ganancias que obtiene son para sus gastos personales y para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Tiene su clientela fija, ya que cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competencia en el pueblo donde reside, trabaja todos los días para aprovechar al máximo su tiempo. Su empuje, tenacidad y esmero le han permitido salir adelante, por ello se motiva para solicitar el crédito con el que desea e, esto le permitirá exhibir bien los productos, creando una mejor imagen en los clientes, lo que para ella significa atraer nuevos compradores y tener más ganancias. Lidia manifiesta que esto le da la oportunidad de avanzar para llegar a cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén, que sea más amplio y con más variedad de surtido, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos económicos, así mejorará la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar y puede seguir apoyando a sus hijas aún desde la distancia.
texts.en:
Lidia is a hardworking woman who is 55 years old. She is the mother of three offspring and lives in a common-law relationship with her partner. Currently she works selling beauty products that two of her daughters, who are distributors, send her from the Atlantic coast. Lidia repays the costs and uses the profits for her personal expenses and to pay for household necessities. She has a fixed customer base because she has the advantage of not having competition in her town. She works every day so that she can make the best use of her time.

Her drive, tenacity and attention to detail have enabled her to get ahead and to apply for a loan that will enable her to display her products well and create a better image for her clients. In this way she will attract new buyers and earn greater profits. Lidia notes that this will give her the opportunity to succeed and to fulfill her dream of opening her own shop, which will be more spacious and have a bigger inventory to meet the needs of her customers thus leading to increased earnings. Consequently she will be able to improve the quality of life of her nuclear family and continue to support her daughters, although from a distance.

loans.use:
to make some alterations to the place where she sells her products (install
shelving).

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo. Hace aproximadamente inició su propio negocio, una sala de internet que montó en su casa, donde cuenta con 6 cabinas adaptadas para prestar el servicio; esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar los recursos económicos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y, al mismo tiempo poder estar al cuidado de su pequeño hijo; trabaja sola de lunes a domingo de 9:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm, buscando aprovechar al máximo el tiempo y poder percibir mejores ingresos cada día. Su empuje, tenacidad y ganas de superación, la impulsan a buscar opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando, por eso y motivada por su bebé, ella solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar más computadores y así poder aumentar el espacio disponible para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos, que en pocas palabras significa para ella, mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia. De esta forma, Sandra desea seguir trabajando arduamente para cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, logrando que este sea reconocido en el sector y le garantice una mejor rentabilidad, para seguir contando con una buena fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young, 20-year-old entrepreneur, and the single mother of one child. She started her own business, an internet cafe, which she runs from her own home. She has six stations set up to offer internet services. She got this idea because of her need to make money to pay her basic household expenses while looking after her young son at the same time. 

Sandra works alone from Monday to Sunday from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm. She seeks to make the most of her time and to generate more income every day. Her drive, dedication and desire to excel push her to seek out options that will let her continue moving forward. For this reason, and because she's motivated to support her baby, she is requesting this loan to buy more computers. This will let her increase the space she has available and provide better services to her customers, which will allow her to generate more income. In short, this will mean improving her family's well-being and quality of life.

Sandra wants to continue to work hard to achieve her dream of expanding her business, which will help her business to be well-known in the sector and  guarantee improved profitability. This will let Sandra continue to have a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy more computers.

loans.name: María Aracelly

texts.es: María es una mujer casada y madre de 6 hijos, que se dedica desde hace 4 años a trabajar en su propio negocio, una panadería y cafetería que inició, motivada por una de sus hijas que tiene un negocio similar en una ciudad de la costa pacífica, ella le enseñó todo lo relacionado con el manejo de este tipo de negocio y además la instruyó en la preparación de los productos de panadería, inicialmente comenzó trabajando con otra de sus hijas pero debido a una grave enfermedad que la atacó, murió hace poco tiempo, sin embargo, con la ayuda y el amor de sus demás hijos ella supo sobrellevar la situación y poco a poco a hecho el duelo de su pérdida. Actualmente otra de sus hijas asumió el reto y se capacitó en la preparación de panes y otros productos como pastelería y repostería y así vienen trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, con el que genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. A pesar de todas las adversidades y las dificultades por las que ha pasado, su empuje, tenacidad y sus ganas de progresar, la impulsaron a solicitar el crédito con el que realizará unas adecuaciones locativas para ampliar el local, pues actualmente sólo tiene una mesa con 3 sillas y un pequeño muro donde se sientan sus clientes, esto le permitirá tener la oportunidad de prestar un mejor servicio y comodidad a sus visitantes, lo que para ella significa recibir mejores ingresos para su familia. María sueña con fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio, posicionarlo en el sector y poder tener un local más amplio y cómodo para sus clientes, esto le dará la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutar al lado de las personas que ama un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
María is married and has six children.  For four years she has worked in her own business, a bakery and cafeteria.  She was motivated to start this business by one of her daughters who has a similar business in a city on the Pacific coast.  She taught her everything related to running this type of business.  She also instructed her in the preparation of the bakery products.  She initially started working with one of her other daughters.  However, due to a serious illness that struck her, she died a little while ago.

Nevertheless, with the help and the love of her other children, she knew how to endure the situation.  Little by little she mourned her loss.  Now, another one of her daughters has assumed the challenge and trained in the preparation of breads and other bakery products and pastries.  They are working in order to get her business ahead.  The business generates enough resources to help her husband with the financial responsibility of the household.

In spite of all of the adversities and difficulties that she has experienced, her drive, tenacity, and desire to progress prompt her to request the loan.  She will use the loan to make improvements in order to expand her place.  She currently only has one table, three chairs, and a small wall where her customers sit.  This will allow her to have the chance to provide better service and comfort to her visitors.  To her this means receiving better income for her family.

María dreams of strengthening and accrediting her business, of positioning herself in the area, and of being able to have a bigger and more comfortable place for her customers.  This will give her the chance to have a better quality of life and of enjoy a better well-being with the people she loves.

loans.use: to make improvements (expand) to her place.

loans.name: Vesitacion

texts.en:
Vesitacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for three years now.

Vesitacion requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, etc. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, etc

loans.name: Florcerpida

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Florcerpida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from videoke rentals.  

Florcerpida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, eggs, milk, noodles, etc., to sell at her general store.

Florcerpida has sustained her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, eggs, milk, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean, a citizen from a rural village located in Prey Chhor district, is 47 years old and lives with her husband and her five children, four of whom are employed at various occupations, so only the youngest one is still dependent on her. For more than thirty years, Sean has been farming rice on two small pieces of land in Kampong Cham province. With the current business, she can earn a small income that is very low for her monthly expenses, so her husband supplements their income by working as a paid laborer.

She, along with her husband, decided to request a loan of $1,500 for home renovation. She will buy wallboard to replace her thatched wall and also buy floorboards, and will build a ladder. She hopes that the loan will be granted to improve her shelter, so she can provide her family with a comfortable and safe place to live in.

loans.use: to buy wallboard to replace her thatched wall and also buy floorboards and build a ladder.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbat is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Kherlen, which is the easternmost town of Mongolia.  They reside in an old, cement house on a plot of land.  He and his wife have both retired from work and receive a state pension.  Last year he began working as a sentry at a private firm.  

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some repair.  So he is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam.  Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house to create a warm and comfortable place for his wife.  They will also burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air in support of the efforts against air pollution.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 63 years old and married with five children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) loan  through NWTF to purchase groceries like chips, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Elisa has borrowed and paid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fishing.

Elisa aspires to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like chips, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en: Ilyn is 40 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Ilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, and spices.  Ilyn has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Ilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, and spices.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice-vending business.

Shirley has been in this business for thirty years, and earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Badamjunii

texts.en: Mr. Badamjunii is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family resides in an old house on a plot of land.  He and his wife have been selling casual clothes to local people by renting a stall at a trade center for fourteen years.  His son is currently unemployed.  His daughters both go to high school.  The house they live in has deteriorated over the years.  So he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, and foam in order to renovate it.  After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass.

loans.name: Akhit

texts.en:
Akhit, 32 years old, lives alone in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has a position as a truck driver and works in a mining company. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolia Tughrik) to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and fewer pollutants are released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Marriane

texts.en: Marriane is 30 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Marriane is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed to sell.  Marriane has been raising pigs for 2 years while earning additional income from poultry and fish vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to send her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feeds to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.  She has a rice grains business in the Philippines while also earning additional income from fishing.  Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Anale

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Annaly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Annaly is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Annaly has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Thuch is 59 years old, a hardworking, enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her farm work and to her family. Since she is a widowed mother, she has raised her children in a rural village in Kampong Chhnang province. She has been a farmer for many years, and continually works in this field as her primary source of income. Because of financial constraints, she couldn’t afford to help her children finish high school, so they all dropped out of school and started in various careers help their mother earn income.

She’s currently asking for help to buy supplies that will improve her rice crop as she needs to apply fertilizer on time to insure a good growth and produce a fruitful harvest. She also will use a portion of the loan to rent a tractor to prepare her one-hectare land for cultivation. She is very grateful for constant support as it’s her second loan cycle with Kiva and fourth cycle with HKL.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Yorlyn

texts.en: Yorlyn is 44 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, sugar and coffee. Yorlyn has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for 10 years. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Her goal is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: Luis es un campesino de 56 años de edad que durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar como jardinero en diferentes fincas y parcelaciones del oriente antioqueño, de esta manera ha sacado adelante a toda su familia, conformada por su esposa y cuatro hijos, a los cuales les ha dado una buena educación para que sean personas de bien. Actualmente tiene un espacio disponible en su casa donde desea iniciar una salsamentaría con servicio de billares, con el fin de tener una actividad adicional que le complemente los ingresos familiares y en la que contará con el apoyo de su familia, mientras él continúa realizando su labor de jardinero. Su empuje, entusiasmo y dinamismo lo motivan para solicitar el crédito, que tomará como un apoyo para realizar las adecuaciones locativas necesarias y comprar el surtido al por mayor (cerveza, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros), así podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto y tendrá la posibilidad de seguir sustentando las necesidades de su familia. Luis encuentra en esta nueva actividad una oportunidad de progresar al lado de las personas que ama y por eso sueña con fortalecer y acreditar muy bien su negocio, tener clientela fija para que sea rentable y así mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is a 56-year-old farmer. Throughout his life he has been devoted to work as a gardener on different farms and other plots of land in eastern Antioquia with which he has helped the whole family progress. His family consists of his wife and four children to whom he has given a good education so they are good people. Currently, he has an available space in his home where he wants to start a store with a billiards service in order to have an additional activity that will supplement the family income. He will have the support of his family as he continues to work as a gardener. His drive, enthusiasm, and dynamism motivate him to request this loan which will be used as support to make the necessary adjustments to his home and purchase wholesale merchandise (beer, sodas, pastries) to start his new project so he will continue to sustain the needs of his family. Luis is in this new activity for a chance to progress alongside the people he loves. He dreams to strengthen and establish his business very well, have regular clients, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: make necessary changes in his home for his business and buy wholesale merchandise (beer, soda, pastries, etc.).

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a student at the American University of Central Asia, in the department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is her profile.

“Study at the American University of Central Asia was my dream, because I believe that high-quality education plays an important role in everybody’s life and gives an opportunity for a better future. AUCA is the best university in Central Asia, with the best professors. In addition AUCA hosts a variety of concerts and activities that help students develop their characters, new skills, etc. with the help of various competitions. An active life in AUCA brings its students together. Thousands of us want to study at AUCA, and I am really happy to be part of it. So, taking an opportunity, I am also applying for a Kiva loan to help me cover my tuition.”

loans.use: to cover my higher education fees.

loans.name: Suesa

texts.en:
Suesa is a 58-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Suesa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, and a pair of gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Suesa hopes to improve her business to help support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, and a pair of gloves

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número cuarto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son mujeres luchadoras que están luchando por sus familias, ya que quieren darles a sus familias lo mejor.
Una de las integrantes es Daisi, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, comenta que a través de su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Quiere seguir creciendo para mejorar su vida y la de su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, quiere también poder seguir creciendo con sus ventas y tener mas clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de distintas marcas con lo que podrá seguir creciendo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Valientes" communal bank is in their 4th cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. They all work together and help each other to get ahead. They are fighters who are fighting for their families, as they wish to give their family the best.

One of the members is Daisi, who sells cosmetics. She comments that through her effort and sacrifice she is improving her life and that of her family. She wants to continue improving her life and her family's giving them everything she could not have. She also wants to increase her sales and have more clients.

Daisi is requesting a loan to invest in buying different brands of cosmetics so she can continue growing and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Puletasi

texts.en: Puletasi is 22 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years, and has requested a loan to buy more pesticide, weed spray, gloves and spades. Puletasi has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, she hopes to improve her business and use her profits to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides, weed spray, gloves and spades

loans.name: Elilibeth

texts.en: Elilibeth is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for nine years, and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 63 years old and single and works hard to help her family.

She has a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her business buying and selling herbal medicine.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra repuestos para realizar la reparación de su motocicleta y poder transportase a su trabajo de la mejor manera y más eficiente. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores repuestos y de buena calidad para que su motocicleta no le dé desperfectos a corto plazo y así poder cumplir con su trabajo de una forma más adecuada y eficiente. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ignacio is 34 years old and single, He lives with his parents and siblings and they are his main priority. Ignacio plans to buy replacement parts to fix his motorcycle and be able to transport himself at work in the best, most efficient manner. He wants to buy the best, top quality parts so he doesn't have problems with his bike in the short term. Then he can carry-out his work in an adequate and efficient manner. His is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the state banks. The loan from FUDECOSUR offers better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en: Levi is a 42-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Levi needs a loan to buy coolers, cordials, sugar and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to save for her child's education. Levi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy coolers, cordials, sugar and foam cups

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Hour is 54 years old, married, and the mother of four children, living in a rural village of the Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. 

She earns a living by working in the construction site alongside her husband, who is a master builder. Together, they can earn a wage of US$ 11 per day, which she usually uses for meals, commodities costs and allowances for her children.

Hour doesn't own a motorcycle for commuting, so she has applied for a loan of US$ 800 from HKL to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill their needs. This purchase will enable them to reduce some expenses on transportation service and go to work on time. 

In the future, Hour aims to save enough to start up a hog-raising business to make additional income to satisfy her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional spices like onions, garlic, ginger, etc. to sell to her customers. Nenita has been in this business for 20 years, and supplements her income by providing motorcycle transportation and farming rice. She has sustained her business activities through her own hard work and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spices like onions, garlic, ginger, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As the married parent of eight children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising pigs. 

Shirley is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish business.

Shirley has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jorge Eliécer

texts.es: Jorge es un emprendedor de 29 años de edad, con un espíritu de superación que lo ha llevado a iniciar su propio negocio, en vista de no conseguir oportunidades de empleo. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, recorre varios municipios del oriente antioqueño vendiendo mercancía a crédito, de manera ambulante, su transporte es una bicicleta adaptada como carreta para poder llevar los productos que ofrece y, de esta forma ha generado los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (armarios, ventiladores, juegos de sábanas, ollas y otros artículos para el hogar), pues así podrá abastecerse para la temporada de fin de año, disminuyendo los costos, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en el margen de ganancia que obtiene por las ventas. Jorge manifiesta que su único desafío es manejar la cartera, pero hasta el momento la ha sabido controlar y todos los clientes han pagado cumplidamente; además sueña con seguir trabajando arduamente y en un futuro pueda tener la oportunidad de montar su propia distribuidora de mercancía, mejorando así la calidad de vida y su bienestar.
texts.en: Jorge is a 29 year old entrepreneur with a can-do spirit that has led him to start his own business when he was not able to find gainful employment. He currently works as an independent merchant, traveling through various municipalities of eastern Antioquia selling merchandise door-to-door on credit. His mode of transportation is a bicycle adapted as a wagon so that he is able to carry the products that he offers. In this way, he has been able to generate sufficient income to take care of his household. With the loan he currently seeks, Jorge will build his business by purchasing wholesale merchandise (cabinets, fans, sheets, pots and pans, and other household items) in preparation for the end of the year sales season. This will reduce costs, which will then increase the profit margin from his sales. Jorge states that his only challenge is managing his portfolio, but to date he has been able to manage it and all of his customers have paid on time. Furthermore, he hopes to continue working hard and to one day open his own distribution business, thereby improving his well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale merchandise (cabinets, fans, sheets, pots and pans, and other household items).

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 19 years old and single, with no children. 

She makes and sells rice and curry in Malie Primary School and in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Lise needs a loan to buy chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, seasoning oil, foil, and foam plates. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. 

Lise has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, seasoning oil, foil, and foam plates

loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area that is smart for the business, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a mega boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve standards of living. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Faaeteete

texts.en: Faaeteete is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells popcorn and ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Faaeteete needs a loan to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies, popcorn, plastic bags and cooking oil for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Faaeteete became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies, popcorn, plastic bags and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothes store where she sells new clothes and also second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra es una ama de casa de 31 años de edad, casada y madre de una hija de 7 años. Vive en un pueblo al sur del departamento y hasta el momento le ha sido difícil emplearse en una empresa. Tiene un espíritu emprendedor y muchas ganas de superarse, por lo que tiene en mente iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicará en un espacio que tiene disponible en su casa, así podrá aprovechar al máximo su tiempo libre, mientras genera los recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Cuenta con experiencia en esta labor, ya que trabajó en la tienda de su abuela durante un año y por eso quiere hacer de esto su principal fuente de ingresos. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertir la totalidad del dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (pastas, granos, azúcar, galletería, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros), de esta forma podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo, del cual espera recibir buenos resultados para salir adelante con su familia. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer ordenada, activa y pujante, lo que le ha permitido hasta el momento cumplir con los objetivos que se propone, por eso, desea trabajar arduamente en su nuevo proyecto y sacarlo adelante, logrando que sea reconocido en el sector y le genere una rentabilidad para que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable, darle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar la calidad de vida de todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 31 year old housewife, she is married, and she is the mother a seven year old daughter. She lives in a town in the south of her district and has had some difficulty finding employment. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and a great desire to get ahead in life, so she is starting her own business, a grocery store that will be located in an open space in her home. Thus she will be able to take advantage of her free time while generating income in order to help her husband with household expenses. She has experience in this work: she worked in her grandmother's store for a year and now wants to make it her principal source of income. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase an assortment of wholesale goods (pastas, grains, sugar, cookies, pastries, soft drinks, etc.). She will be able to get her project up and running, and she expects good results that will allow her and her family to get ahead.

Sandra is a very lively and orderly woman, which has allowed her to achieve all of the goals she has set for herself. For this reason she hopes to work hard in her new role and make it successful, becoming recognized in the area and generating a good income that will allow her to enjoy good economic stability, provide for the education of her daughter, and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase a variety of wholesale goods (pastas, grains, sugar, cookies, pastries, soft drinks, and other items).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothes store where she sells new clothes and also second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Joviline

texts.en:
Joviline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joviline is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

Joviline has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Joviline has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Joviline has been in this business for two years. In the future, Joviline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be jolly. She operates a retail shop where she sells soda, water and beverages. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a stock of beverages. She hopes that in the future, she will have her own home. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy stock of beverages.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 23 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riem

texts.en:
Riem, 53, is a villager residing in Ruessei Kaev district, a suburban area about 14km far from Phnom Penh. He is married and has four children, whom he loves very much. His children motivate him and his wife in their business of selling fish in order to provide enough for them. The income he earns from this type of business usually goes to food and other home expenses. He’s been in this business for nearly 11 years. Although it’s hard work, it’s a way of earning a life honestly.

Riem is taking out a loan to help with his current business. This loan will be used to buy both fresh and dried fish to sell at his store. His dream is that he can develop his business and increase his sales, so that he can give his family more financial stability, give his children a better education and improve the whole family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of ten children, Fortunata works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and raising pigs. Fortunata is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries for her general store business.

Fortunata has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 47 years old. She usually sells fish and vegetables for a profitable price in the village. Her offered products are fresh from the ocean where the fish are being caught, and her vegetables are grown organically. This quality of offered products has helped her generate good income and has also resulted in high demand for her products. This convinces her to request for additional business capital of 5,000 PHP to buy more varieties and higher volume of fish and vegetables. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more varieties and higher volume of fish and vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be social and faithful. He is a photographer and takes photos to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a camera. His business goal is to employ five people within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve standards of living of his family members. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a camera for his photography business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 26 years old and married with four children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, soap, noodles, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, soap, noodles, etc

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 48 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old, married, and works hard to help her husband earn a living.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Susan is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie sells juice and snacks at her small stall within the school vicinity. She has been doing this for over one year and earns a net of PHP2,500 per month. She would like to offer more food products for her student customers and teachers in order to meet all their food needs and increase also her sales. She is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 as added capital to purchase stocks of biscuits, candies, breads, coconuts for coconut juice, seasonings/ingredients and more. She hopes to gain higher income through help of this financial assistance to improve her families living standard and be able to save for the education of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of biscuits, candies, breads, coconuts, seasonings/ingredients and more

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   LOLO   sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  AFOU fait le commerce de pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tien en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  3 douzaines de pagnes wax  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Lolo group are married women who on average are 33 years old with three children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Babemba, a populous neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their twelfth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Ms. Afou trades wax pagnes (type of colorful West-African fabric) in this group of women. She is standing in the second position from left to right.

She intends to use the loan to buy three dozen wax pagnes and retail them for cash on site and at the market to a clientele of women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a crab culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Margarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her crab culture business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expandiing her business and repairing her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygame à Kadiolo Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo dans la région de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur 11ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  CHATA fait la transformation et la commercialisation d’amandes de karité en  beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femme. Elle  se tien à l’extrême droite. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environs 300 kg  d’amande de karité qu’elle transforme et vend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguiya group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kadiolo Noumousso, one of the districts in the city of Kadiolo, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are on their eleventh loan with the  Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet the needs of their customers.

In this group of women Ms. Chata processes shea kernels into shea butter for retail sales. She is seated at the far right.

She intends to use her loan to buy 300 kg of shea kernels she processes and retails on the spot with her family, for cash, to a clientele consisting for the most part of women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy shea kernels

loans.name: Candido

texts.es:
Candido de 63 años,  está casado y tienen  3 hijas de  16, 14 y 10 años, las  3 estudian educación básica  y  se esmeran en apoyarlas para que tengan éxito, ya que ellos solo estudiaron hasta 2° y apenas leen y escriben. 

Candido se ha dedicado al trabajo de siembra de granos básicos, toda su vida ya que culturalmente  es el trabajo  del campesino, él como un hombre emprendedor además de este trabajo,  se dedica a vender cocos  en el parque para generar ingresos  adicionales para su familia. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para realizarse un tratamiento  médico, pues le han descubierto que tiene algunos problemas en su sistema nervioso, el tratamiento está valorado en $300; pero él ya cuenta con una parte.

En el futuro cercano, piensa recuperarse para continuar desempeñando, sus actividades diarias con las que se gana la vida.
texts.en:
63-year-old Candido is married and has three daughters, aged 16, 14, and 10 years, who are at school. He and his wife go to a lot of effort to support their daughters so that they are successful, since they only studied until the second grade themselves and hardly read or write.

Candido has made a living from planting staple crops his whole life, since culturally it is the work of farmer. As he is an enterprising man, he also sells coconuts in the park in order to generate additional income for his family.

The loan will be used to pay for a medical treatment, as it has been discovered that he has some problems in his nervous system. The treatment will be $300, but he already has part of this amount.

In the near future, he plans to recuperate so that he can continue with the work by which he earns a living.

loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras,  esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos Manuel is 44 years old and married. He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With his loan he will purchase fertilizers and fungicides, pay labourers to help with the coffee crop, and purchase some seed-starting trays in order to replant his crops. This is with the objective of increasing the density of plants and taking advantage of the fertility of the soil, the climatic conditions, and other conditions which favour coffee growing. With these improvements to the crops, he hopes to obtain a little profit and thereby improve the living conditions of his family, invest a little more in the crops, and also fulfil some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Mutisya

texts.en: Mutisya is a 19-year-old single man. He describes himself as talkative. He operates an electronics shop where he sells televisions, batteries, mobile phones, chargers and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more electronics to resell. He hopes that in the future he will have a happy educated family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more electronics to resell

loans.name: Señor De Tantanmarca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE TANTAMARCA, este banco está situado en la comunidad de Yanacona, distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Charmeli tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia elabora diversos platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia vende en uno de los mercados del lugar a todo sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, arroz, aceite entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de chicha, venta de verduras, agricultura, crianza de animales menores  venta de cds.

Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto por motivos de salud y trabajo no pudieron asistir a la reunion por ese motivo se les tomo en dos grupos.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Tantanmarca”. This bank is situated in the community of Yanacona, in the district and province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. The member, Charmeli, is 26 years old and has a partner and one child. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling food. The member has been making a living from this business for a while, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She makes various meals, such as arroz con pollo (chicken with rice), lomo saltado (traditional Peruvian stirfry), and soups, and she sells them in one of the markets to all the clients who request them. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she helps her family to get ahead in this way.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as meat, rice, and oil.

The other members make a living by selling maize drinks, selling vegetables, doing agricultural activities, raising young animals, and selling CDs.
The members in the attached photos could not attend the meeting due to health reasons or work commitments; for this reason, the photos were taken in two groups.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as meat, rice, and oil

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel, tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y realizar algunas labores de conservación de suelos para evitar la erosión que se da principalmente por el agua de lluvia y así conservar un poco más la fertilidad y después realizar la siembra del almácigo de chile, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores productos y de buena calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, además tener a corto plazo una buena producción. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 53 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. With his loan he intends to buy fertilizers and pay for labour for preparing the land and carrying out some soil conservation work. This will prevent the erosion which is mainly caused by rainfall and so maintain the fertility a little better. After this he will plant chilli seedlings and by doing all of this he will be sure of doing a good job. He wants to buy the best good quality products so that his plants are healthy and develop well, as well as getting a good yield in the short term.

This is the first loan he has had with FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from State banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan on better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant chilli plants.

loans.name: Joel Adalberto

texts.es:
Joel de 30 años,  vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 2, 4, 7 y 12 años, de los cuales  2 de ellos estudian, en la escuela del cantón. Su compañera de vida se dedica a oficios domésticos.
Joel tiene 14 años de experiencia en el área de la soldadura, teniendo como resultados buenos ingresos. Esta actividad, la aprendió recibiendo algunas técnicas de parte de los amigos, familiares y la mayor parte la aprendió de ayudante de soldador.
Se le estará ayudando para que Joel,  pueda invertir en la compra de más equipo de soldadura; ya que expreso que con el préstamo quiere comprar un compresor, planta, pulidora, etc. y con esto tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos, será más ágil  y rápido para hacer los trabajos a sus clientes. 
 Su sueño, es tener una vivienda propia y su propio taller de soldadura a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Joel, 30, lives with his common-law wife and their four children, ages 2,4, 7 and 12, two of which go to the local school.  His wife is a domestic employee.

Joel has 14 years' experience in the welding business and earns a good living.  He learned the trade from friends and family but most of his experience is from working as a welding assistant.

Joel is receiving help so he can buy more welding equipment.  He says he will use the loan to buy a compressor, a polisher, etc. which will give him an opportunity to improve his income.  It will allow him to work with more flexibility and be able to turn around customer orders more quickly.

His dream is to have his own home and welding workshop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a compressor, polisher, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba., perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. El socio es el Sr. Miguel Arcangel; ; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de madera, el vende en forma independiente en la provincia de Urubamba y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de madera. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Miguel Arcancel, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  He alternates his daily activities with timber sales which he does independently in the province of Urubamba.  He is able to earn a living this way to provide for his children.  

Miguel Arcangel is requesting a loan to buy wholesale timber so he can expand his business.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale timber.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. María; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados y tambien vende chicha (bebida a base de maiz),la socia tambien vende jora que es un producto que se utiliza para hacer la chicha,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia quiere mejorar sus negocios de venta de chicha y ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para hacer chicha y alimentos para ganados. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, María, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUMPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  María alternates her daily activities with buying and selling livestock as well as a corn-based drink called "chicha".  She also sells one of its ingredients, jora.  She works as a street vendor and wants to improve her livestock and chicha businesses.

María is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and ingredients to make chicha.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and ingredients to make "chicha".

loans.name: Alfredo Armando

texts.es:
Alfredo de 49 años,  es un hombre que le gusta mucha trabajar y además es emprendedor, porque desempeña muchos roles en el hogar. Posee, muchos deseos de seguir mejorando con sus labores diarias. Actualmente vive con su suegra y una hija de 9 años de edad que estudia en la ciudad.

Alfredo desempeña varias actividades que le generan ingresos, como la venta le comida por pedidos y sándwich, que los elabora con una receta única, ya que los clientes lo prefieren. También, practica el oficio de electricista obteniendo de esa manera un ingreso para la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materia prima y productos, porque quiere estar preparado para cuando le soliciten la comida, y pueda tener los insumos para elaborarla y entregarla más rápidamente, y también quiere abrir un cafetin para vender sus sándwich a los alumnos que pasan por ahí.

 Tener un negocio mas grande y así tener mas ingresos para la familia. Ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 49, is an entrepreneur who enjoys working hard and playing several roles in the household.  He also wants to continue to improve in his daily work activities.  He lives with his mother-in-law and nine-year-old daughter who studies in the city.

In order to earn a living, Alfredo sells food and sandwiches on an order basis.  He has a unique recipe that his customers prefer.  He also works as an electrician to earn extra income.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy raw materials and other products he needs for his food business.  He wants to have supplies on hand so he can deliver orders more quickly.  He plans to open a coffee shop to sell sandwiches to students who pass by the business.

His dream is to expand his business and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and products for his food business.

loans.name: Rosa Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Rosa Paulina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de sus hijos, la socia es ama de casa y su pareja trabaja en el negocio de transporte y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un negocio propio. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer arreglar su casa y comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso y arena. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Rosa Paulina, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUMPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children.

Rosa Paulina alternates her daily activities between raising her children and doing housework.  Her husband works in the transport business and together they are raising the family, although she would like to have her own business.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, plaster and sand to renovate her home.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygame à Kadiolo Koko un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo. 
Elles sont à leur 23ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Kadia fait le commerce  de tubercules et condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle  se tien débout au milieu. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des condiments:  10 paquets de cube maggi, 3 paniers de gombo séché, 5 kg d’oignon séché qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguiya Group are all married women with an average age of 40 years, and an average of 5 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Kadiolo Koko which is a district of the town of Kadiolo.  This will be the 23rd loan for this group with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  The group have requested the loan in order to be able to meet the needs of their customers.  

Mrs Kadia sells tubers and other ingredients within this group of women.  Kadia is standing in the middle of the photo.  She will use her loan to buy ingredients, 10 packets of Maggi bouillon cubes, 3 baskets of dried okra and 5kg of dried onions.  She sells her products locally, through retail cash sales, to customers who are primarily women.  She hopes to earn a monthly average of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan with interest and to save for the future.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments

loans.name: Kithumbi

texts.en:
Kithumbi is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Kithumbi describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. Kithumbi will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. Kithumbi hopes that in the future, she will be able to support her family financially with her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Wilma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 25 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming calamondin (fruit tree) in the Philippines. Leslie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers.

Leslie has been farming calamondin for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru:
Сафармох сельская женщина, имеющая пятерых детей. Она около 15 лет вместе с мужем в своем районе Бохтар занимаются сельской промышленностью. Муж работает на грядке и помогает жене. Сафармох ухаживает и следит за скотами. У нее во дворе сейчас одна корова с теленком. Эту корову Вы можете увидеть на фотографии. 
   Сафармох еще в юности в доме у родителей кормила и доила коров, поэтому она много знает о деятельности животноводства. Сафармох в будущем хочет расширить свой скотный двор. А сейчас она торопится увеличить поголовье скота, поэтому запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить двух коров. Она надеется, что они станут началом для продвижения в ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Safarmoh is a woman who has five children and lives in the countryside. Together with her husband, she has been working on agricultural endeavors in the Bohtar district for about 15 years.
