They have three children, all of whom attend school as Idalia wants them to have the education that was denied her because of her family’s poverty. She still works as a maid and has now been with the same family for eight years. It is thanks to this work that she has been able to fulfill all her obligations. To get to her place of work, Idalia has to walk some two kilometres every day from her house. She has to get up very early to do all the household chores before leaving for work in the centre of town. Her children attend school in the mornings while she is at work, and in the afternoon her aunt takes care of them.

With the loan money Idalia plans to buy cement, sand, and blocks to build another room on to her house and provide more space for her family. It will also make her feel safer as it will be built of stronger material than is currently the case. Buying the materials at one time will result in a lower cost too, as will transporting them in one single journey.

In the future Idalia wants to complete building her house so she will feel even safer. She also wants to provide her children with an education so they can get good jobs, and to see her grandchildren grow up in a close-knit family.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, and blocks to build another room on to her house

loans.name: Erika Abigail

texts.es:
Erika Abigail tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hija, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti donde sus pobladores realizan actividades agrícolas y comercio a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo que se ubica en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños en su propio domicilio desde hace más de 2 años y ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y de esta manera poder ampliar su negocio teniendo mejores ingresos que le permiten tener una mejor calidad e vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Erika Abigail is 21 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in a large community in the urban district of Cayalti. The district, whose inhabitants engage in agriculture and trade, is an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is located in the Lambayeque region in northern coastal Perú.

Erika has been making a living selling clothing for men, women and children in her own home for more than two years. She has applied for a loan in order to purchase merchandise. In this way she will be able to expand her business and earn more income. This will enable her and her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 47 años, es casada con Enrique y vive en su casa de madera con sus 3 hijos. Desde que fue joven se dedica a cultivar y vender cacao orgánico que produce en su terreno de 2 hectáreas. Se inició con el apoyo de su pareja que le ayudó a comprar las parcelas que trabaja actualmente con mucha responsabilidad en beneficio de sus 3 hijos. Cada mañana debe dirigirse desde muy temprano a su centro de labores que esta ubicado a 1 hora desde su comunidad y donde realiza sus tareas cotidianas en beneficio de mantener en buen estado sus plantaciones de cacao. Entre sus principales necesidades esta el de contar siempre con dinero para invertir en sus parcelas con la compra de insumos tales como abonos orgánicos y pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudan a realizar el retiro de maleza. Entre sus principales objetivos a largo plazo esta de poner un negocio dedicado a la venta de abarrotes y asó obtener ingresos adicionales a su labor.Es el primer préstamo que solicita y espera al igual que muchos agricultores de su zona tener la confianza para seguir trabajando.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 47-years-old, married to Enrique, and lives in a wooden house with her three children. Since she was young, she has made her living growing and selling organic cocoa produced on their area of 2 hectares. It began with the support of her partner who helped her buy the parcels of land they are currently working with a lot of responsibility on benefit their three children. Every morning she must leave very early to their land located 1 hour from their community and carry out her daily tasks to keep the cocoa plants in good condition. Among her main necessities is that she always has money to invest in her plots with the purchase of inputs such as organic fertilizers and to pay day laborers to help with the removal of weeds. Among her long term goals are to open a business dedicated to selling groceries and obtain additional income for her work. This is her first loan request and she hopes, like many other farmers in her area, to have the confidence to keep working. 
She wants to take this opportunity to have 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her cocoa plants.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Ofelia tiene 25 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León, madre soltera de un hijo y estudiante universitaria. Ella con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha salido adelante para brindarle a su hijo una vida mejor. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia quien la apoya en todas las decisiones que toma la joven en pro del beneficio de ella y de su hijo. La joven quiere ser un ejemplo para su hijo y se sienta orgulloso de sus logros. Cursa el último año de su carrera y su mayor sueño es ser una profesional exitosa. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación ya que quiere graduarse lo más antes posible. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que tendrá mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
25-year old Ofelia is a native of León. She is a single mother of a son and she attends university. She is working hard and making a lot of effort to provide her son with a better life. Her family helps her with all decisions that she has to make for herself and her son. She wishes to be an example to him so that he is proud of her achievements.

Ofelia is in her last year of school and her greatest dream is to be a successful professional. She is seeking a loan to pay for her courses as she wishes to graduate as soon as possible. The loan will be a great help to her since it will lead to a better quality of life.

loans.use: pay for university courses

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Teresa, aged 49, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, her business partner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Teresa is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. 

Maria Teresa hopes that all her children will finish a good education and dreams that her business will flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”;  El socio es el Sr.Teodocio; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de construcción civil, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio trabaja en las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como martillos,clavos,sierra entre otros.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Sr. Teodocio, belongs to the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” Communal Bank. His daily activities include his work in civil construction. He has been doing this work for a long time and it has gone well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day. He works at different construction sites that request his services.

This member is applying for a loan to purchase tools, such as hammers, nails and a saw among other items.

This member is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tools, such as hammers, nails and a saw among other items.

loans.name: Grover

texts.es:
Grover tiene 30 años, es soltero y sin hijos. Actualmente reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble que le fue cedido por sus padres. Cuando cumplió 19 años logró ser propietario de un terreno y desde entonces viene desempeñando labores agrícolas como es el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico.
Tiene hasta el momento 10 años de experiencia y comenta que al inicio no fue nada sencillo realizar el solo las tareas agrícolas para brindarle el cuidado y mantenimiento necesarios a sus plantaciones de cacao y otros ya que no contaba con dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores que lo apoyen en las tareas complicadas.
Se siente muy identificado con su labor ya que es un oficio que realizar desde muy niño con mucha responsabilidad y dedicación. Le agrada mucho partir las mazorcas de cacao tras la cosecha para el cual tiene mucha habilidad donde posteriormente solo queda secar las almendras extraídas y llevarlos hasta la ciudad para comercializarlas. Comenta que siempre es necesario contar con dinero disponible para la compra de abono orgánico y tener una producción estable. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Grover is 30 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. He currently lives in a well-built house which was left to him by his parents. When he was 19 he succeeded in buying land and since then he has grown organic cocoa plants there.

He now has ten years of experience doing this work. At the beginning it wasn’t easy to do the work all by himself as he didn’t have enough money to hire laborers to help him with the complex tasks.

Grover feels very committed to this kind of work as he has been doing it with responsibility and dedication ever since he was a young man. He greatly enjoys stripping the pods from the cocoa plants after the harvest as he can do this with great skill. Then only the beans remain to be dried and taken to the city where they are sold.

Grover notes that it is always necessary to have money available to buy organic manure and have stable production. This is his second loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for this financial assistance which helps him get ahead. He promises to make the repayments punctually. He now needs 2,000 soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: buy organic manure

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 33 years old and married. She has five children. Suzette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a food-vending business.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Suzette has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is married, and a mother of two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells cereals to earn a living. She always struggles to improve her stall, trying to sell more and save money, in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of maize grain, beans, rice and wheat for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize grain, beans, rice and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
Marciano de 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos,, en casa también convive con su esposa y forman un equipo de trabajo para ayudar a los ingresos de la familia.

Tiene 10 años de dedicar al comercio de productos lácteos, aprendió de un amigo que trabajaba de manera similar y visualizo el comercio ayudado por su familia, pues él consigue los clientes y sus hijos le ayudad a distribuir el producto.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 200 libras de queso para la época seca y mantener el negocio comprando leche y procesarla.
.
En un futuro espera comprar un vehículo para facilitar la distribución de su producto y apoyar a su padre en la agricultura
texts.en:
Marciano is 55 years old and is married with 5 children. He lives with his wife and together they work as a team to help with the family income. He has been selling dairy products for 10 years. He learnt the business from a friend who works in a similar way and saw the business being helped by the family. Marciano finds the customers and his children help him to deliver the products.

The loan will be used to buy 200 pounds of cheese for the dry period and to keep the business going, buying milk and processing it.

In the future he hopes to buy a vehicle to make his product deliveries easier and to help his father in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy 200 pounds of cheese.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Khoern is a married mother of seven children. She lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. Of her seven children, two are dependent on her and still in school. Khoern is a rice farmer. She has been in the business for almost 30 years, and she can earn about 39,000KHR per day. She can save about 20,000KHR each day.
 
This is the first loan for Khoern’s group with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy materials for constructing a latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a latrine

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 53 years old, married, and has six children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs and buying and selling coconut wine.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Grace Del Rocío

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó con el negocio de la venta de cosméticos y ropa por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y darles el cuidado adecuado.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo en todo momento, por cuenta propia.  Es madre soltera y sus 2 hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea en un futuro poder tener su local propio en casa para comercializar su mercadería ahí.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos y libros para sus hijos
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Durán.  She started with a business selling cosmetics and clothes because she needed to support her children and give them proper care.  She works Monday to Sunday all the time on her own.  She’s a single mother and her two children attend the local public school.  In future she’d like to have a locale of her own in which to sell her goods.  The loan she needs now is to buy notebooks and books for her children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and books.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos Alexander con 29 años de edad, soltero, vive con sus padres, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores que se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la Provincia de Chiclayo en el Región Lambayeque que está ubicada en la parte norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, además realiza labores agrícolas desde hace mas de 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales y alimento balanceado para la crianza de los mismos y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Alexander, 29 years old, is single and lives with his parents in a small community in the rural area of Cayalti. This community engages in agriculture and the commercial raising of small animals. It is located an hour from the province of Chiclayo in Lambayeque region, which is in northern Perú.

He makes a living raising and selling small animals in an area behind his house. He has also engaged in agricultural work for more than five years. He has requested a loan of S/. 1,500 to purchase more animals as well as nutritional feed. In this way he will expand his business and be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals and nutritional feed.

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior tiene 21 años de edad vive junto a sus abuelos en la comunidad de Cayalti a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo que se ubica en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

El es conocido en su medio por dedicarse al trasporte público desde hace 03 años transportando a sus clientes en su mototaxi de Cayaltí a Zaña y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles que le permitirá hacer mantenimiento de su mototaxi para su mejor uso en su negocio y así tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Junior is 21 and lives with his grandparents in the community of Cayaltí, which is one hour from Chiclayo city in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He is known in the area as he has worked in public transport for 3 years, transporting customers from Cayaltí to Zaña in his motorcycle taxi. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN to maintain his motorcycle taxi in order to improve its use in his business and thus obtain a better income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Idolenses Group

texts.en:
The six women of the group Mujeres Idolenses live in San José El Idolo, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  Legend has it that this town was formerly called El Idolo.  When the Spanish conquerors came, they rested here for a while.  When they moved on, in gratitude to the people of the town, they left a sculpture of San José.  The people then changed the name of the town to San José El Idolo (Saint Joseph The Idol). 
 
The women of this group have businesses that include selling food, wood, clothing or household goods.  There is also a dressmaker and a small store.  These are poor women with a great desire to better their lives and the lives of their families.  They now have the opportunity to do this by upgrading their businesses and increasing their profits with the help of Namaste’s business advisors and money management classes.

Angela (3rd from left) is 64 and does not know how to read or write.  She has a life partner but she is the only one contributing to the house and business.  She has had her store for about ten years.  Unfortunately, four years ago a car ran over her leg and she almost lost her foot.  She was not able to work for two years, during which time her partner took care of the store for her.  However, without her guidance the store did not do as well and her profits went way down.  With her loan, she wants to buy what she needs to stock her store with things her customers want.  She can then bring her sales to the level where she had them before the accident.  She currently has a monthly profit of around US $117, working 140 hours a month.  She believes that if she can provide the items her customers need, she will increase her profits to about US $247.

loans.use: to increase her store's stock back up to where it was before her accident.

loans.name: Mesrob

texts.en:
Mesrob lives in the village Artsvanik, which is the most beautiful village in Syunik region, with its rich nature, sunny people and sweet harvests. Mesrob works at the mining company, as a locksmith. He is married, and he has two school-aged sons. His wife works at the local school, as a cleaner.

Mesrob is engaged in farming and agriculture, simultaneously with his job at the mining company. He has five cows, two calves, three piglets, and twenty chickens. He cultivates on his plot of land fruits and vegetables, some part of which they use for their family, and the rest he sells at the local wholesale market.

Mesrob asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams, in order to buy several heifers and add them to the number of his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several heifers and add them to the number of his cattle

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 33 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. 

With the loan, Olive would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business, for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó su actividad de taxi ambulante cuando0 se jubiló de la policía nacional y se compró un carro.  Para poder laborar tuvo que adaptarlo a su condición física y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.  Trabaja solo, todos los días y algunas veces también con un chofer ayudante.  Es viudo y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  A futuro, le gustaría poder construir su vivienda y comprar una hacienda para trabajar en ella también.  Ahora desea invertir el crédito en el mejoramiento de su casa y en los arreglos de su vehículo.
texts.en:
This client is from Guayaquil’s Isla sector.  He started driving a taxi when he retired from the national police and bought a car.  To work he had to adapt it to his physical condition and to date he’s done very well.

He works alone every day but sometimes has an assistant driver.  He’s a widower and has two adult children.  In future, he’d like to build his house and buy a farm to work as well.  He wants to use the loan for home and vehicle repairs.

loans.use: to do home repairs and to service his taxi.

loans.name: Remecita

texts.en:
Remecita is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Remecita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Remecita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en: Vazgen is 67 years old and he lives in Sevan City which is in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. Vazgen is married and he has a son and a daughter. Both of his children are married; Vazgen's son and his family live with him while his daughter lives separately with her family. Vazgen’s son works as a tailor. His wife does not work and she takes care of their children and the house. Vazgen’s wife died recently making him very upset and unhappy, but life goes on anyway. Now Vazgen works as a hairdresser and he rents a space for his business. He has many loyal customers and he is satisfied with his income. Vazgen requests a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams in order to privatize the space where he works now.

loans.use: to privatize the space where he works now

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is a 29-year-old married man. He lives with his parents, wife, brother, sister-in-law, and two children in a small village of Khulo district. His wife works as a baker and earns 150 GEL per month. Ramin is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two cows and sells cheese products. In addition, Ramin cultivates family-owned land and grows maize and potatoes to sell. 

Ramin decided to start a honey business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1500 GEL to purchase beehives with bee colonies. Ramin will start producing honey and sell it at a good price to increase the income of his family. With this increased income, Ramin will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 46 years old. She is married with four children. She sells bananas and sorghum and has been in the business for the past 3 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Kimeang's Group

texts.en:
Kimeang, a married woman living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, in Battambang province, is aged 58 years and a mother of four children. For the past 10 years, Kimeang has been working as a rice farmer, and she also grows various kinds of vegetables to support her family. The current business earns her about 90,000KHR per day. She can save about 50,000KHR each day, after daily living expenses.

Kimeang has been a member of VisionFund for nine loan cycles already, and she completely paid back the previous loans. She used the loans from VisionFund to better support her business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to reap more crops from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sav's Group

texts.en:
Sav, 38, is a married mother of three children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her family, Sav has been farming. The current business earns her about 44,00KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

Sav’s group consists of three members and she is the leader of this group. She is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem is a 70-year-old widowed mother of two children who lives in her own home in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province. Soem devotes herself to a farming business and also sells natural medicines for additional income. Her children always help maintain the family's plot of land and help her to sell natural medicines in the markets.

Soem would like to improve her current business, so she has requested a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy natural medicines to sell. With the help of the loan, she hopes to sustain her current business and boost her income and earnings. She is very pleased and thankful for this help and promises to pay back all of the money.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for sale.

loans.name: Heracle

texts.en:
He is a farmer and married to a farmer. They have been blessed with three children. He's been in the farming business, particularly corn farming, for almost fifteen years. From his last crop he earned a net income of PHP 38,000.

He needs capital to plant corn, so he decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 45,000. He will use it to purchase organic fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticide for his farming business. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted, so that his business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticide

loans.name: Carmelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Carmelinda works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Carmelinda is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall.

Carmelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store (sari-sari) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Connie earns additional income from food vending.

Connie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Connie dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like pork skin, oil, salt etc for her food vending business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 20 years. Rosalina earns additional income from videoke (entertainment).

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like pork skin, oil, salt etc

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Vilma is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF, to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell, for her coconut wine vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is 27 years old, married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Isnaida has a general store business in the Philippines. Isnaida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Isnaida has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Isnaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase aditional stock of items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó vendiendo cosméticos y actualmente se dedica también a la venta de comida en tarrina (almuerzos) a los trabajadores de distintas compañías.  Con esto, ella ayuda con los gastos de su hogar y le agrada mucho esta actividad.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, de 10 am a 2 pm.  No es casada pero tiene hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Le gustaría en un futuro poder terminar la construcción de su casa y disfrutarla con su familia; además, tener un local comercial para montar un restaurante y vender desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas; y por último, comprar un vehículo para movilizarse.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de utensilios de cocina y abarrotes para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Isla sector.  She started out selling cosmetics and now also works selling food (prepared lunches) to employees in various firms.  This helps her cover household expenses and she enjoys this work very much.  She works alone every day from 10am until 2pm.  She’s unmarried but has adult children.  In future, she’d like to be able to finish building her house and enjoy it with her family.  Also, to have a commercial site to open a restaurant and sell breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Lastly, to buy a vehicle to get around in.  She needs the loan now to buy kitchen utensils and foodstuffs to prepare the meals she sells.

loans.use: to buy utensils and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has operated a retail  business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. He cites seasonality as his major challenge in the business. 

Paul is requesting Kshs 40,000 to boost his kiosk and add to his stock.  He will purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. He appreciates the support of the previous loan, and dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
A 32-year-old mother of four children, Sim resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 26,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 16,000 each day for their future needs.

This is the first loan for Sim with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the lack of working capital to better support her family’s business, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sim will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kungkea

texts.en:
Kungkea, a rural villager from Battambang province's Thmor Koul, is 23 years old and single. He is a teacher to earn a living. Having engaged in this business for several years, Kungkea is able to save up to five US dollars per day from his current job after deducting expenses. 

This is a first-cycle loan for Kungkea with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now he is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years so he can study General Management. He sincerely hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover his entire tuition fee for four years

loans.name: Khoern

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Khoern is 39 years old, married, and has seven children. Three of her children are still in school. She earns a living by catching fish. Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Khoern is in her seventh cycle loan with VisionFund; she has completely paid back the previous six loans. She used the loans smartly and gradually increased her income. She wants to use her new loan to buy a boat for supporting her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish that she can sell for a good price. Her goal is to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a boat

loans.name: Medilena

texts.en:
Medilena is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to help her family. Medilena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, eggs, noodles, spices, cream, and sugar.

In the future, Medilena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 60 years old. She is a mother of five children. Most of her children are married and are not dependent upon her. She has sold beans and sorghum for the past seven years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans to sell. She will reinvest the profits to make a better future for the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  buy additional items like eggs, rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell at her general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hermoso

texts.en:
Hermoso is 48 years old, widowed father of four children. Three of his children are in school.

Hermoso is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Hermoso requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF, to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

Hermoso has been farming rice for twenty years, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.  Hermoso aspires to save enough money to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль 57 лет, замужем, дети все взрослые, проживают отдельно. У Анаркуль - средне-специальное образование, работает преподавателем в медицинском колледже. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Анаркуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Анаркуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния своих детей.
texts.en:
Anarkul is 57 years old and married.  Her children are all grown up and live separately.  Anarkul has specialized secondary education and works as an instructor at a medical college.  To supplement her family's income, Anarkul raises livestock.  She started this business 20 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 3,000 KGS.  Thanks to Anarkul's hard work, she now has 3 milking cows and 10 sheep.  Her monthly income is 25,000 KGS.  

In order to expand her business, Anarkul applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS.  She is planning to use the loan to purchase calves for fattening and subsequent resale.  Anarkul intends to use some of her profits to purchase additional cattle and use the rest to improve her childrens' financial situations.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Pedro Paz

texts.es:
Pedro de 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y no tiene hijos, solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado. Solamente vive con su compañera de vida.

Pedro se dedica a la cría de ganado bovino, tiene 6 vacas lecheras que ordeña diariamente para después vender una parte de la leche,  en las tiendas del pueblo; la otra parte la utiliza la compañera de vida para elaborar queso y venderlo.

Tiene 17 años de trabajar de esta forma, además es agricultor desde los 12 años, este oficio también lo aprendió de su padre. Para llegar al lugar de trabajo tiene que desplazarse 2 km y lo hace en una motocicleta que compro con sus ahorros. Su compañera de vida, también le ayuda con el cuido de los animales de 4 de la mañana a seis de la mañana y trabaja en el campo de  7 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde.


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar  una vaca, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos, le producirá leche y comercializara. Espera un futuro, renovar su lote de ganado y duplicar su producción de leche, pues considera que a sido su mejor fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old and has a partner but no children. He was only able to study as far as 6th grade and lives with just his partner. Pedro earns a living raising cattle. He has 6 dairy cows which he milks every day and then sells some of the milk in shops in the town. His partner uses the rest of the milk to make cheese to sell. He has been doing this for 17 years and has also been a farmer for 12 years. He also learnt this business from his father.

Pedro has to travel 2 km to reach his place of work and uses a motorbike which he bought with his savings. His partner also helps him to look after the animals from 4am until 6am and works in the field from 7am until 2pm. 

The loan will be used to buy a cow, which will allow him to make more income as it will produce milk to sell.

In future he hopes to renew his herd of cattle and double his milk production, since he thinks this has been his best source of income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, 36, is married with two children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She has two children, one of whom is a dependent and in school. For the last ten years, she has been selling fish as a primary source of her family’s income, while her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. They can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saret’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans from VisionFund helped her better support her family. Saret, who is the leader of her group, will use her portion of the loan to buy more fish for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Chong's Group

texts.en:
Chong is 36 years old, married, with seven children. She is originally from a rural village of the Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkol Borey district, She and her husband earn a living by working as paid workers. Having been in this business for over than 10 years, she is able to earn about KHR20,000 per day and manage to save about KHR10,000 each day for the future needs.

Chong is the fourth cycled client with VisionFund and she completely repaid the previous three loans. She used the loans smartly to gradually improve her standard of living. Chong who is the leader, wants to use this loan to buy household supplies for her family, and use a portion of it to buy clothes for her children. She hopes this loan will make her living better, and she hopes to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En is 57 years old and a married mother of seven children. She lives with her two dependent children in her own house, while the other five have settled down with their families. She works in agriculture, growing rice in paddy fields in Kampong Thom province, and also works as a day laborer. En knows that it’s not easy to get ahead in life, but she is always seeking opportunities that will give her a better life.

En wants to help her employed children with a transportation they need for daily commuting. Because of the lack of funds, she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy a used motorcycle, which will enables them to work on time and without paying on taxi service daily. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her children.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 45 years old. She is married to a farmer and has six children. She wants to take a loan to buy more bananas for making locally produced beers. She has a plan to generate savings from the business and expand business volume.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to make more locally produced beers for sale.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is 61 years old and married, with five children. 

Bernarda is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock for her business.

Bernarda has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Churek

texts.ru: Чурек 52 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 4 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Чурек - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чурек занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чурек, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Дополнительным доходом являются денежные переводы сына, который находится на заработках  в России.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чурек обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом. Доходы от кредита Чурек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния своих детей.
texts.en:
Churek is 52 years old.  After the death of her husband, she has been raising their 4 children and running the household on her own.  Churek has secondary specialized education.  Her family's main source of income is raising of livestock, a business that she started 10 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to Churek's hard work, her household now has two milking cows and one horse.  Her son supplements the income by working abroad, in Russia, as a translator.  Her entire monthly income is 15,000 KGS.  

In order to expand her business, Churek applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS, to purchase calves.  Churek plans to re-invest some of the profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock and save the rest with the goal of improving her childrens' financial situations.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Saingry's Group

texts.en:
Saingry, 28, is married and has three children. She resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, in Battambang province. One of her children is in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for three years, while her husband works as a paid worker for others. Together, they can earn about KHR50,000 per day and can save about KHR20,000 each day, for future needs.
 
Saingry’s group consists of two members, who are both female. Saingry has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans to VisionFund, and she successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a new loan. Saingry will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to reap more rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Niña Charry

texts.en:
Niña Charry is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Niña Charry is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Niña Charry has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is a citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She is 48 years old and married with two children. For the last ten years, she has been selling grocery items and raising ducks and chickens. With the current business, she can earn about KHR85,000 per day and can save about KHR20,000 each day for the future needs.
Soern is just with VisionFund for this this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Soern is going to use her portion to buy chicken and ducks feeds to nourish them and use a portion of it to spend buying grocery items for resale. She hopes to fatten her chickens and ducks so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy chicken and duck feed for nourishment

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana de 47 años, estudio hasta 4 grado,  esta soltera actualmente,  pues hace 9 años que se separó del esposo de ella. 

Es madre de cuatro hijos, los cuales aún viven con ella, 3 de ellos trabajan y uno estudia  en casa de ella.

Ana se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño puesto fuera de su casa donde vende refrescos, enchiladas, nuégados, pasteles de masa con papas. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, decidió dedicarse a eso porque fue la única forma de ayudar a su familia; luego que se separara del esposo. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad, realizaba los oficios domésticos en casas de la colonia, dónde le pagaban por sus servicios aún tiene esta entrada de dinero; pero es de medio tiempo.  

Ana necesita el dinero, para ayudar a su hija menor a graduarse  la universidad.  Ella no tiene la posibilidad de adquirir el dinero suficiente para solventar los gastos de graduación. Ella pagara la parte final de la tesis de graduación y comprara los insumos necesarios para el acto de graduación.

Desea seguir luchando fuerte, por sus hijos aunque ya son grandes, ella espera verlos triunfar y lograr sus sueños y cuando pueda ayudarlos en lo que necesitan, ese es su sueño para su familia.

Un día pretende instalar su  propio negocio en su casa,  para ya no salir a trabajar lejos y poder ayudar de mejor manera no solo a sus hijos sino a su demás familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 47, completed fourth grade.  She’s currently single for she separated from her husband nine years ago.  She’s mother of four children that still live with her; three of them work and one attends school.

Ana’s a merchant.  She has a small stand outside her house where she sells refreshments, enchiladas, fried cassava balls, potato turnovers.  She’s been in this activity four years and decided to go into this because it was the only way to help her family after her separation from her husband.  Before going into this business she worked as a domestic employee in houses in the neighborhood earning a salary for her services.  She still has this source of income but it’s only half-time.

Ana needs the money to help her youngest daughter graduate university.  She’s unable to get enough money to cover graduation costs.  She will pay the final graduation thesis costs and will buy the necessary things for the graduation ceremony.

She wants to continue working hard for her children even though they are grown up already.  She hopes to see them succeed and reach their dreams and to help them whenever she can; this is her dream for her family.

One day, she intends to open her own home-based business to not have to go out to work far away anymore and to be able to better help not just her children but the rest of her family too.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's final thesis costs and graduation fees.

loans.name: Ingrid Xiomara

texts.es:
Ingrid de 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato. En su casa convive solo con su abuela y no tiene a nadie que dependa de ella.

Ingrid se dedica al comercio y distribución de tambos de gas propano, tiene un año trabajando de esta forma. Adquirió la experiencia necesaria, cuando trabajo para una empresa que se dedicaba a lo mismo. Hoy en día es su única fuente de ingreso. El producto lo llegan a dejar cerca de su casa los distribuidores, y ella se encarga después de distribuirlo en la zona con el apoyo de un amigo.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar 100 tambos de gas propano y así satisfacer toda la demanda de la zona, al ser una persona con visión al futuro, espera obtener mejores ingresos y así algún día establecer una tienda formal que venda productos de primera necesidad y también comprar una motocicleta para repartir el producto.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 22, is single and has no children. She was only able to study through high school. She lives with her grandmother and doesn’t have any dependents.

Ingrid makes a living selling and distributing tanks of propane gas. She’s been doing this kind of work for one year. She gained the necessary experience when she worked for a company doing the same kind of thing. Today, that is her only source of income. The products are delivered to her home. Then, she is in charge of distributing them in the area with the help of a friend.

This loan will be used to buy 100 tanks of propane gas to meet the demand in the area. Ingrid is a forward-thinking person; she hopes to obtain more income to some day start up a formal store that sells essential products and also to buy a motorcycle to deliver the products.

loans.use: to buy 100 tanks of propane gas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en la zona de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó con esta actividad de venta de dulces desde hace 3 años, cuando sufrió el despido de la empresa donde trabajaba.  Le agrada mucho lo que hace ahora, dado que si puede ver las ganancias día a día.  Trabaja solo, todos los días, de 12 a 8 pm.  Es viudo y tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad.  Desea a futuro, poder conseguir un local comercial en el cual pueda distribuir los productos que vende y también dar trabajo a otras personas con condiciones, para mejorar los estilos de vida suyo y de todos.  De igual forma, le gustaría poder formar una familia y casarse.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de confites para su venta.
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Isla zone.  He started selling sweets three years ago when he was laid off at the firm where he was employed.  He enjoys what he does now because he earns daily profits.  He works alone every day from noon to 8pm.  He’s a widower with an adult son.  In future, he wants to be able to get a commercial site to distribute the goods he sells and also to provide employment to others in similar conditions to improve his and all of their lives.  Similarly, he’d like to get married and form a family.  He needs the loan money to buy sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia se sigue dedicando al negocio de siembra y cosecha de verduras,la socia vende las verduras en los diferentes mercadosla socia vende zanahorias,tomates,zapallos entre otras verduras,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas.

La socia esta feliz ocn el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucia continues growing and harvesting vegetables that she sells in various markets.  She sells carrots, tomatoes and squash, among others.  She works from 7am until 5pm and has been in this business several years.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the vegetables.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia Purificacion se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y la socia tambien siembra verduras como repollo,choclos,zanahorias y zapallos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de agricultura y crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Purificación continues working in agriculture and raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She also grows vegetables like cabbage, corn, carrots and squash.  She works from 8am until 6pm and has been doing very well in business for 7 years.  Her dream is to expand the vegetable and animal sales and she’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicks and feed for them.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ingredients needed to make dish-washing liquid. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more ingredients needed to make dish-washing liquid. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ramona hopes to be more successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed for making dish-washing liquid for her business.

loans.name: Mizuka Youth Group

texts.en:
Mizuka Youth Group is composed of young people who are passionate about football. Upon winning numerous local trophies, the youth decided to embark on economic activities that will make them self-sufficient. As a result they started growing and selling vegetables, distributing water, and showing movie screenings. Antony, on the far left, has a passion for football and is married with one child. His desire is to see football players have decent lives after their professional career is over, and he believes that is possible through entrepreneurship. 

Last year, the group successfully completed a Junior Achievement entrepreneurship program where the program built their capability to grow and expand their businesses. Upon graduation the group carried out market research and observed the demand for rabbit meat within their community. Antony and his fellow group members hope to take a loan to start a rabbit rearing business which will supplement the group's vegetable and water business and will increase their realized income.

loans.use: to purchase materials required to build a rabbit rearing unit and rabbits

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, Héctor de 11 años de edad, José de 7 años de edad, Elmer de 5 años de edad y Alonso de 2 años de edad; solo el menor de sus hijos no estudia. Él estudio hasta 2° grado y todos dependen de sus ingresos.

José comercializa pollos de engorde, encuba los huevos hasta los 22 días y después de nacidos los alimenta y vacuna por 7 semanas hasta que alcancen el peso de venta. Todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su hermano, quine fue capacitado por la fundación CAMPO. También es agricultor, trabaja con granos básicos, pero su principal y más grande fuente de ingresos es la venta del pollo.

El Préstamo será utilizado en la compra de 3 sacos de concentrado de crecimiento para pollo, 4 quintales de formula, insecticida y abono foliar para sembrar frijol.

José tiene como meta, darle el estudio completo a sus hijos ya que es un privilegio que él no pudo tener, quiere comprar un medio de transporte para movilizarse con sus aves y venderlas, además de comprar sus insumos, también espera poder hacer unas reparaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and has a partner and four children: Hector, 11; Jose, 7; Elmer, 5; and Alonso, 2. Only the youngest of his children does not go to school. José studied until the 2nd grade. His family depends on him for income. 

José sells chickens reared for meat. He incubates the eggs for 22 days, then feeds and vaccinates them over seven weeks, when they reach a good weight for sale. He learned this business from his brother, who was trained by the CAMPO foundation. José is also a farmer; he grows basic grains, but his primary source of income is from selling chickens. 

The loan requested will be used to purchase three bags of chicken feed, 400 lbs of fertilizer, insecticide, and a nutrient spray for growing beans. 

José's goal is that his children complete their education, a privilege that he didn't have. He would like to buy a means of transport in order to sell the chickens and purchase supplies. He also hopes to be able to make some improvements in his house.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of chicken feed, about 400 lbs of "18-46-0" fertilizer, insecticide, and nutrient spray to grow beans.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es: José es originario de la Cuidad de León, un joven humilde y emprendedor de 28 años de edad, estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil. El con dedicación y esfuerzo quiere ser un hombre de provecho. Su meta es obtener su título universitario y ayudar a su familia económicamente. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación  y alcanzar su anhelo de graduarse y empezar su futuro como profesional. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra su sueño y mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is from the city of León. He’s a humble, enterprising, 28-year-old man studying Civil Engineering.  With dedication and effort he wants to become a successful man.  His goal is to get his university degree and help his family economically.  He’s requesting the loan to pay for his final course and reach his goal of graduating and starting on his future as a professional.  He believes that this loan will be of much help for him because he’ll reach his dream and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay final course fees.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina nació en el centro poblado de Huayocari del distrito de Huayllabamba,la socia pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI,la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Josefina was born in the populated settlement of Huayocari in Huayllabamba District.  She belongs to the Pro Mujer de Huayocari communal bank.  She continues working in agriculture and raising livestock.  She’s been in this business for some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her field.  She’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Yerson Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,el socio los ganados los hece engordar y crecer y luego los vende en diferentes ferias y el socio en sus terrenos siembra maiz y papa,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar sus pequeños negocios de agricultura y ganaderia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

EL socio esta contento con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues in the cattle-raising and agriculture business.  He fattens up the cattle, makes them grow and then sells them in various livestock fairs.  He grows corn and potatoes on his land.  He’s been in business several years and does very well.  His dream is to expand his small agricultural and animal husbandry businesses.  He’s asking for the loan to buy cattle and cattle feed.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is a 39-year-old married man living in the Tsalka District with his wife and four school-age children. Levan rents out two perforators (construction tool) and this rent is the only income for this large family.  

Levan owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $1,100 will help Levan to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. This will allow Levan to offer cheap service to his customers and attract them. 

With this Startup loan, Levan will start a taxi business and generate income for covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to change the fuel system of his car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Merling Margarita

texts.es: Merling es originaria de la ciudad de León, estudiante universitaria de la carrera de Contaduría pública y finanzas. De 21 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo el cual tiene a su cargo y ha sacado adelante junto a su esposo y familia. Ella con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado estudiar, hoy en día cursa el último año de su carrera. Solicita este crédito para pagar su curso de titulación con el fin de ser una profesional con éxito. Su meta es poder graduarse y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Merling’s from the city of León.  She’s a university student majoring in Public Accounting and Finance.  She’s 21-years-old, married and mother of a son who she cares for and is raising alongside her husband and family.  With much effort and dedication she’s been able to study and is currently in the final year of her career.  She’s asking for this loan to pay for her final course in order to become a successful professional.  Her goal is to be able to graduate in order to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay final course costs.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Residing in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Heang is 56 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom still count on her and are still in school. She has struggled to make a living through growing cassava and corn for five years and she is able to earn up to 26 U.S. dollars per day. However, she is able to save only six USD dollar per day after deducting all related expenses. 

Heang has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for five cycles. Now, she is applying as a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund asking for an education loan to pay for the school fees of her daughter for the four years. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue the degree so as to find a good job after graduation and also help her to relieve her financial burden and her worry in the future in supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her daughter for the four years

loans.name: Jitahidi Youth Group

texts.en: Jitahidi Youth Group was formed when a group of young people who were in the business of garbage collection decided to come together to provide socio-economic support to each other. As a result, the group established a merry-go round where they would provide micro loans and emergency loans to its members. Joseph, on the far right, is a single father raising a child with the help of his parents. He has successfully completed training on life skills, and he hopes to use the loan in starting a poultry business. The group was identified by Junior Achievement and they are currently undergoing an entrepreneurship program with the objective of building their capacity to grow and expand their businesses. Through market research the group has seen the opportunity for selling eggs and chickens in the community and have already constructed a brooder for their venture. Through mentoring from Junior Achievement, the group will be able to embark on a poultry business and be successful, given the demand for the product and the newly acquired business skills that the members of the group have.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for chicks to start a poultry business

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Исмоил имеет высшее образование по специальности экономиста. Он работал во многих местах после окончания университета. Данное время он работает заместителем директора в частном санатории. Он выполняет свою работу отлично и поэтому его коллеги очень уважают его. Исмоил хочет, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его дочь Нодира учится в Российско-Таджикском университете. Нодира учится на втором курсе. Она является одной из успешных студентов. Нодира планирует продолжать свою учебу после окончания университета в магистратуре. Исмоил должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ismoil is a hard-working and an honest man.  He is 48 years old, married and has three children.  Ismoil has a university education in economics.  After graduating from the university, he worked in a variety of places.  Currently, he is working as a deputy director at a private nursing home.  He performs his job perfectly and his colleagues respect him for it.  Ismoil wants his children to receive university education as well.  

His daughter, Nodira, is studying at the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University.  Nodira is a sophomore.  She is one of the best students at her school.  After graduating from the university, Nodira is planning to continue on to study for a Masters degree.  Ismoil is asking for a loan to pay for his daughter's tuition costs.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's university education

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; La socia es la Sra. Gladys; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y pollos, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para su negocio. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa" communal bank. Her name is Gladys. She has a business selling guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these small animals and later sells them to the customers that request them. She has been working in this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She is a responsible and diligent person, which helps her to move her family forward.

Gladys requests this loan so that she can purchase guinea pigs for her business. She feels fortunate to get the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia Nicolasa pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI,la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Nicolasa belongs to the Pro Mujer de Huayocari communal bank and continues working in agriculture.  She’s been in this activity for some time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She also continues raising small animals.  She’s a responsible, hardworking person who supports her family this way.  She’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 41 years old. She is married with four children. She has been in the business of selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 57-year-old woman, is from Ozamiz City; she is married and blessed with six children. 

From her desire to help the family, aside from corn production she has engaged in firewood vending to earn additional income for her living. Her family has been in this business activity for 10 years already as their main source of income. 

In 2010, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. And now, she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of Php 15,000. This loan is intended for land redemption to acquire more space of land for corn production. The income from her business will be the pay-off for the loan she requested from PMPC. She dreams of nothing more than to have a  happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income out of her business.

Rosita deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to redeem farmland

loans.name: Banzi

texts.en:
Banzi operates a retail selling business,  selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
This is Marife. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marife hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en el sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando se capacitó en una fundación para no videntes.  Luego comenzó con la producción de productos químicos y le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora.  Posteriormente también emprendió con la venta de bebidas desde su hogar, como agua y malta.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, de 8 am a 10 pm.  Es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, quienes son todos mayores de edad.  A futuro, le gustaría poder comprarse un vehículo para poder movilizarse y también tener un local para distribuir los productos que elabora.  Por el momento, necesita el crédito para la compra de químicos y bebidas para su comercialización.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Isla sector.  She started out some time ago after getting training  at a foundation for the visually impaired.
